title: Senior Software Engineer (.NET Core)
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 We are a forward-thinking team creating cutting-edge, cloud-based communication solutions. Our backend systems leverage the latest C# and .NET Core technologies, deployed in Kubernetes on AWS. We thrive on collaboration, innovation, and crafting scalable, reliable systems that power seamless communication worldwide.
   

  

 If you're a Senior Backend Engineer with a passion for problem-solving, clean code, and modern DevOps practices, we'd love to have you on our team.
   

  

**Role**
 As a Senior Backend Engineer, you'll take ownership of developing and maintaining high-performing backend systems while contributing to all stages of the software lifecycle. In this role, you will:
   

  

* Develop scalable and resilient distributed systems using C# and .NET Core.
* Work closely with engineers, DevOps specialists, and product managers in an agile, cross-functional team.
* Build and maintain applications running on Kubernetes, actively monitor production systems, and ensure reliability.
* Leverage AWS tools and services to deploy, optimize, and scale cloud-based systems.
* Write clean, testable, and maintainable code, with a focus on system performance and scalability.
* Enhance automation, streamline CI/CD pipelines, and troubleshoot issues proactively.
* Influence architectural decisions and actively contribute to enhancing our development and operational practices.


**Requirements**
* Major professional experience building and maintaining backend systems in production.
* Expertise in C#, .NET Core, and developing distributed systems.
* Solid understanding of DevOps principles and experience with CI/CD pipelines.
* Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset.
* A passion for clean, testable code and modern software practices.


**Good to have**
* Service-oriented architecture and microservices.
* Relational and NoSQL databases (e.g., MySQL, MSSQL, Redis).
* Hands-on experience with Kubernetes and AWS.
* Incident response and on-call rotations.
* Proficiency in additional programming languages such as C++, Python, or Kotlin
* Experience with Asterisk and VoIP protocols, preferably SIP.


 Embrace the challenge and join us! You will have the chance to:
   

  

* Work with a talented and diverse team in a culture that values innovation and collaboration.
* Take on meaningful challenges and grow with the latest technologies.
* Enjoy flexibility with remote work options and a healthy work-life balance.
* Benefit from competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package, including healthcare insurance, pension contributions, and wellness allowance.


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: . No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Game developer
description:
We are now looking for the best game developer to join us! You have the chance to be a part of creating the best casino games in the online slot industry!
   

  

**Job Description**
* Design, develop and maintain Casino Games for both desktop and mobile browsers
* The technologies you primarily will work with are HTML5, WebGL, Typescript, Pixi, GSAP and Javascript.
* In a team environment that consists of product management, graphic artistry, sound creation, server development and game mechanics, you will contribute to deliver the best casino games in the market today.
* Your main responsibilities are to make the game graphics come alive with spectacular animations, game flow, game mechanics and sounds according to a result delivered by our game servers.


 Who you are
   

  

* You are a Master Google Searcher that have Stackoverflow as your absolute favourite web site.
* You have practical experience of working with OOP in some language and you have a pragmatic approach to software development.
* Taking on technical challenges and solving them is something you take pride in.
* Quality, not only of the code you write, but the delivered system is important to you.
* You thrive in an environment where you are responsible for your code and take ownership of changes from editor to production system.


 Beneficial skills
   

  

* Working experience of mobile browsers and knowledge about their limitations and how they work in different ways is a big plus.


 Who we are
   

  

 We are the best and fastest growing slot provider in the world with the operator and product in focus, and the mobile future on our minds. Nolimit is a team of experienced professionals from the gambling industry in Stockholm, Sweden, Malta and Gurugram, India. Our company has derived from hands on work at some of the most successful gambling software providers and operators over the last 15 years. Our mission is to offer a fast, reliable and flexible team that cooperates with the best operators in the world, taking gambling to the next level.
   

  

 We have a clean code high performance modern mini/micro service portable system platform for mobile and desktop that is 100 % under our own control. Since we have our own platform, this allows us to deliver special features and smooth, customizable marketing campaigns that are tailored to the operator's specific needs. We think it's time for a new angle to the gambling software industry – one where the product is in focus and we fully engage their promotion, marketing and country manager system/activities with our games. Nolimit work with customers on a global scale and the largest gambling operators in the world have our games everywhere.
   

  

 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
   

  

 Send your application to hr-sweden@nolimitcity.com
   

  

 http://www.nolimitcity.com

description:

title: Senior Backend Developer
description:
CtrlPrint is an international, fast growing SaaS company building the market leading collaboration platform for corporate reporting projects. Our headquarters is located in Stockholm, we have local offices in London, Helsinki and Sydney and support customers globally. We are an inclusive, respectful and inspired company where everyone plays a key part to our success. We are sincere and transparent and always willing to learn and develop to stay competitive, and are a successful company on a strong profitable growth trajectory. In 2023 and 2024 we were named a Gasell company by Dagens Industri and we established a position on Breakit:s list of successful SaaS companies in Sweden.
 



  





 The CtrlPrint platform is mature, successful and continuously expanding to meet customer needs. Our engineering department is organised in autonomous squads working closely with the product department. We are now looking for an experienced backend developer with at least five years experience of backend development, including three years in Go, to take a leading role amongst our backend engineers. The right candidate should have experience from working with application architecture, a proven track record of sound architectural decisions, a solid understanding of web application development, good database knowledge (PostgreSQL) and a relevant university degree. 
 



  





**You will** 




 As backend developer you will take part in developing the backend of our platform using Go. You will collaborate with your squad and the engineering team to reach our ambitious goals and help take our platform to the next level. You will drive architectural discussions in our Backend Guild, identifying the best way forward, weighing parameters like time, scalability, stability and risk, and anchoring decisions with the CTO and the Operations department. You will be responsible for ensuring a high-quality scalable and stable platform with a great user experience.
 


* Work in a squad in the engineering department, closely with other engineers, designers and product managers.
* Take responsibility for architectural decisions and data modeling, considering the overall impact on the application, the users, future maintenance and costs.
* Support, guide and mentor other team members.
* Take a leading role in the Backend Guild
* Initiate technology upgrades needed within the guild and in time.
* Take great responsibility for reviewing other team members' code to make sure it follows the internal requirements of security, performance, code clarity and readability as described in the Code Review Process.
* Take great responsibility for and represent the Engineering team in cross departmental work for example across squads (Guilds), teams (Product, Operations, Engineering) or departments (Client Services, Sales, Marketing etc) and work closely with other engineers, QA, designers and product managers.
* Suggest, initiate and execute improvements to work processes and engineering experience.
* Together with the Engineering Manager make sure the development process is properly documented and when needed initiate and implement changes to the process to improve Engineering team efficiency and quality of work.
* Design, develop and maintain secure and well-structured web applications and APIs that follow best practices and the internal Development Guidelines.
* Develop test cases and perform unit- and integration testing.
* Troubleshoot and debug the application.
* Make sure the relevant system documentation is up to date, for example for onboarding new engineers.
* Stay up to date with the latest relevant trends, techniques, and technologies.
* Participate in the Product Discovery-process



  





**You are** 




 An experienced, curious and motivated professional who considers yourself a team collaborator. You have the ability to work closely in cross-functional teams, good problem solving skills and possess strong communication skills. You are curious and interested in learning more about the business and processes of corporate reporting and our platform’s users, to ensure the platform's success. You are eager to work closely with squad and team members to ensure projects and tasks are completed on time, identifying potential issues, devising effective solutions and sharing information with other team members in order to make informed decisions. The successful candidate should also have good organisational skills and the ability to meet tight deadlines.

title: Frontend Developer
description:
**ComeOn Group in short** 




 Founded in 2008, ComeOn Group is a leading global player in the rapidly growing iGaming market. Having launched its first online brand in 2010, ComeOn Group offers 15 brands across multiple markets on its proprietary platform providing a secure, innovative and entertainment-led player experience across casino and sports betting. ComeOn Group is an international employer within the iGaming industry and has over 550 talented employees across 7 main locations.
 



**Location: Stockholm + Hybrid (fully remote is not possible)** 




 As a Frontend developer you will work on UI components that deal with new brand creation, analytics, SEO and some compliance related features. It also involves high level of collaboration with the rest of the cross functional team. for example brainstorming, define technical structure and implement the product and its technical solutions.
 



**Requirements** 



* Be a role model towards other developers in the team
* Keeping yourself up-to-date with latest and greatest in the JS ecosystem
* Encouraging to new ideas
* Being a good communicator also requires you to work on your listening skills and ability to understand others.
* Well organized - be more autonomous in your work, you'll be asked to help others, as well as to review or attend meetings; you also have to monitor multiple projects at the same time.
* Supporting the team to boost their skills to create a stimulating work environment.
* Be an engine to improve the product and boost team productivity



**About You** 



* In depth knowledge of JavaScript (preferably 5+ years)
* Previous experience with large scale React/SPA applications and good experience in React and its ecosystem such as Redux, React-router.
* Good experience with CSS, Sass and libraries like styled-components.
* Strong fundamentals of web development and good debugging skills.
* Good experience working with component based architecture.
* Know your way around GIT .
* Experience with web performance and tools like lighthouse.
* Understanding of frontend tooling - for ex - web pack
* Good knowledge of W3 standard, Web APIs
* Take end-to-end ownership of the products, from design to release.
* Good understanding of UI/UX - we love super-cool animations
* Having full stack experience is a plus, especially full stack within Java.It is a plus but not mandatory to have domain knowledge (igaming)



**Benefits** 




**So what can you expect from ComeOn as a place of work?** 



* A diverse, modern and inclusive workplace
* Cozy office in central Stockholm
* Extensive insurance coverage, including private healthcare insurance
* Private pension insurance via Söderberg & Partners
* 30 days of paid vacation per year
* Wellness allowance of 5000 SEK per year
* Parental leave top-up
* Breakfast at the office every day
* A one-time allowance of 2500 SEK to help you set up a comfortable workstation at home
* On top of our hybrid arrangement, up to 40 days per year to work fully remotely from anywhere in the world
* Brand new laptop and smartphone with paid subscription
* Fun company events, team activities and Friday beers



 At ComeOn, we've embraced a Hybrid Work model, giving our employees the flexibility to work some days at home. Our offices are thoughtfully designed to support this model, featuring practical workspaces for focused efforts and collaborative zones for dynamic creative exchanges. We believe in the power of collaboration to drive innovation and success. While our offices are known for their vibrant atmosphere, rest assured that our primary focus is on achieving results together. We prioritize efficiency and maintain a balance between hard work and camaraderie. When you visit our offices, expect a warm welcome and professional support. Choose ComeOn for your next career move, and experience a workplace that values productivity, teamwork, and the spirit of collaboration.
 



 At ComeOn Group we value diversity and we take concrete action to ensure fairness in our recruitment process. We are committed to assess candidates on their merit without discriminating against any applicant for whatever reason that is protected by law. We truly value you, as you are.
 



 Want to know more about us just visit our website www.comeon-group.com or any of our social media channels to take a deep dive into our culture!
 



 LinkedIn
 



 Instagram
 



 Facebook

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**Software: fuel for mobility**
 We bring bold digital visions to life. So we’re on the lookout for more curious and creative engineers who want to create change – one line of high-quality code at a time. Our transformation isn't for everyone, but if you're excited about solving the leading-edge technological challenges facing the auto industry, then let’s talk about your next move.
   

  

 Let's introduce ourselves
   

  

 We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer for our Federated Graph team with a passion for building robust, scalable, and efficient systems. This team is part of the Product , Offer & Pricing cluster within the larger Commercial Digital organisation.
   

  

 Our Federated Graph team is responsible for the GraphQL endpoint which primarily drives our global website and e-commerce flow.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
 Role Description:
   

  

 As a Senior SW Engineer you will develop mostly in TypeScript, both back and front-end, and work closely with teams who provide content and data to the endpoint, and with the teams which consume the data to build our website.
   

  

 Job Responsibilities:
   

  

* Own and develop our Federated GraphQL platform: Lead the design, implementation, and maintenance of our Federated GraphQL endpoint and associated infrastructure. You will manage a monorepo for subgraphs, ensuring schema quality, modularity, and scalability. You will be a steward for the federated data schema and consuming teams’ queries.
* Drive Improvements: Continuously identify opportunities for improvement within the platform, balancing the need for clean, maintainable code with practical, timely solutions. Your work will directly impact the efficiency and reliability of our systems.
* Collaborate Across Teams: Work closely with cross-functional teams, both back-end and front-end developers, to deliver new features and enhancements. Your ability to communicate complex technical concepts clearly and effectively will be key to your success.
* Monitor and Optimize: Utilize metrics, logs, and tracing to monitor system performance, troubleshoot issues, and proactively optimize the platform. Your keen interest in observability will help us maintain high standards of reliability and performance.
* Champion Best Practices: Advocate for and implement best practices in software engineering, including code reviews, testing, and continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD). You will mentor junior engineers and contribute to a culture of continuous learning and improvement.


**What You'll Bring**
 We hope you are a self-starter who thrives in an environment where you can take ownership of your work. You’re proactive in identifying areas for improvement and taking the necessary steps to address them. We consider effective communication in a team imporatnt. You have strong verbal and written communication skills, enabling you to convey technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
   

  

 More of what we hope you'll bring.
   

  

* Technical Expertise: Proficient in TypeScript and Node.js, with a solid understanding of modern software development practices. Experience with deployment infrastructure is essential.
* Desirable Skills: Familiarity with Rust is a plus, as is experience in federated GraphQL architectures. An interest in metrics, logging, and tracing is highly valued.
* Balanced Approach: You understand the importance of writing clean, maintainable code, but you also know when to prioritize pragmatism to meet business needs.


 Ready to Take the Next Step?
   

  

 Please submit your application through our career page. Due to GDPR regulations, we’re unable to store or consider applications from other platforms. Make sure to submit your application in English.
   

  

 Once your application is successfully submitted, you’ll receive a confirmation email. We’re excited to get to know you!
   

  

 Volvo Cars – driving change together
   

  

 Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse and inclusive working environment. Today, we’re one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, so you can reach your fullest potential.
   

  

 And it’s so exciting – we’re well on our way on our journey towards full electrification. We have five fully electric cars already on the market, and five more on the way. Our fully-electric and plug-in hybrid cars combined make up almost 50 per cent of our sales. So come and join us in shaping the future of mobility. There’s never been a more rewarding time to play your part in our inspiring and creative teams!
   

  

 Curious about Life at Volvo Cars? Read more
   

  

 Curious about our story? Read more

title: Software Engineer
description:
På qte jobbar strax över 50 problemlösare som hjälper företag att boosta sina affärer med hjälp av tech. Vi skräddarsyr digitala lösningar som tar företagen framåt, och gör allt från mobilapplikationer till komplexa it-system. Vi är stolta vinnare av en Di-gasell, och ännu mer stolta över vår placering som Sveriges 6:e bästa arbetsplats i IT-branschen. Här jobbar bland andra utvecklare, designers, strateger och projektledare, och nu vill vi utöka våra teams med fler mjukvaruutvecklare.
   

  

 Vi letar efter dig som har arbetat med mjukvaruutveckling i några år och har högskoleexamen samt god förståelse för hur man driver lyckade mjukvaruprojekt. Förutom att du har ett driv och passion för utveckling tar du ansvar för den kod du levererar och hjälper gärna dina mer juniora medarbetare framåt. I denna tjänst är du med och tar beslut tillsammans med ditt team och tar stort ägandeskap för vad ni producerar. Det är en roll som låter dig ta nästa steg i din karriär.
   

  

 Som mjukvaruutvecklare på qte handlar jobbet om mycket mer än bara utveckling. Vi väntar oss att du är en problemlösare som använder tech som ett sätt att lösa våra kunders utmaningar. För det behöver du ha stark affärsförståelse och förmågan att anpassa tekniska lösningar för att möta specifika affärsbehov. Du kommer jobba i en utmanande miljö där kunder och kollegor har höga förväntningar på ditt arbete, så det är viktigt att du tycker det är kul och drivs av hitta lösningar på komplexa problem.
   

  

 Som anställd på qte handlar jobbet om mycket mer än bara jobb. Vi är en arbetsplats där du utmanas, utvecklas och har roligt tillsammans med dina kollegor. Många väljer att börja hos oss tack vare den välkomnande, avslappnade stämningen vi har, som du känner av direkt när du besöker oss. Vi vill vara en arbetsplats som vi själva vi jobba på, och det innebär bland annat att vi jobbar när och var vi vill och att vi har frivilliga, gemensamma aktiviteter varje månad. Vi är inte Sveriges 6:e bästa arbetsplats utan anledning!
   

  

**Vem Du Är**
* Minst 3 års relevant erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling samt erfarenhet av att skriva kod av hög kvalitet som går att underhålla under en lång tid.
* Har stark problemlösningsförmåga.
* Har starka kunskaper i programmeringsspråk såsom TypeScript, Java, Go, eller C# samt erfarenhet av att arbeta med databaser och komplexa datamodeller.
* Har förmåga att förstå och tillämpa affärsprinciper i tekniska lösningar.
* Har förmåga att effektivt kommunicera tekniska koncept till icke-tekniska stakeholders.
* Är bekväm med att kommunicera på svenska till kunder och kollegor.


**Vad du kommer jobba med:**
* Utveckla mjukvarulösningar: Skapa och implementera anpassade mjukvarulösningar i Typescript/NodeJS. Var aktiv i hela utvecklingsprocessen, från design till implementation och support.
* Affärsutveckling: Använd din förståelse för affärsprocesser och branschspecifika utmaningar för att designa lösningar som möter kundens behov och bidrar till deras framgång.
* Kundkommunikation: Arbeta nära kunder för att förstå deras affärsmål och översätta dessa till tekniska krav.
* Problemlösning: Anpassa dig snabbt till nya teknologier och affärsmiljöer. Visa upp starka problemlösningsförmågor i utmanande projekt.
* Samarbete och ledarskap: Arbeta i tvärfunktionella team och bidra till en positiv och produktiv arbetsmiljö. Visa upp ledaregenskaper när situationen kräver det. Coacha och stötta andra utvecklare.


**Övrigt**
 Denna position kräver starka kommunikationsfärdigheter på både svenska och engelska. Vi tillämpar 6 månaders provanställning. Du bör även vara bosatt i Sverige.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Låter det som din nästa utmaning? Sök redan idag eftersom vi anställer löpande. Vid frågor är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till vår HR-chef Ami Gustafson på 070 – 974 96 41 eller ami@qte.se.
   

  

**qte är en strategisk techpartner som hjälper företag att boosta sina affärer med hjälp av tech. Vi skräddarsyr digitala lösningar som tar företag framåt, och gör allt från mobilapplikationer till komplexa it-system. Som techpartner arbetar vi långsiktigt och kontinuerligt med kunder som DHL, Koenigsegg och Världens Barn. 2023 stod qte som vinnare av en Di-gasell och 2024 blev vi utsedda till Sveriges 6:e bästa arbetsplats inom IT-branschen. Sedan 2024 är qte en del av Qvik Group.**

title: Python Developer
description:
You are a highly skilled developer with at least five years of experience working on mid to large-size projects.
 



 You have expertise in software development using Python and C++, along with a strong knowledge of CI/CD, GitLab, and AWS.
 



 You have an understanding of Docker and Network basics.

title: Java Backend Developer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Job Description**
* You will work as a senior developer in the team
* Strengthen our Backend and development capabilities to ensure delivery and operation of both new solutions we are developing and existing functionality
* Close cooperation with the other developers in the team and with Product owner and Area architects
* You will work with everyone in the team, with several different stakeholders and team members in surrounding teams


**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* >5 years' experience working as a Java backend developer
* Knowledge working with Java, Spring and micro service architecture
* Experience working with agile methods


**Technical Skills**
* Extensive experience building Spring boot microservices and REST based API services
* Proficient in Java 17 and above
* Good understanding of Micro service and event-based architecture
* Experience with Docker containerization and Kubernetes
* Knowledge of Event streaming platforms like Kafka
* Understanding of Databases (SQL/MongoDB)
* Experience working with Cloud Technologies(Azure preferred)
* Familiarity with build tools such as Maven and Gradle.


**Meritorious**
* Prior experience working with Frontend development
* Infrastructure experience, Terraform, IAC
* Swedish skills


**Application deadline:** 
 12-02-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Business Developer
description:
**Are you a dynamic and analytical professional with a passion for innovation and sustainable energy? We are growing our Business team with a talented Business Developer to join our ambitious team.**
**What We Do At Blykalla**
*Blykalla is a Swedish producer of advanced small modular reactors (SMRs). Our design is based on 25+ years of research, which we are now taking to market. A perfect complement to intermittent energy sources, our goal is to provide the baseload energy necessary to enable a full transition to a fossil-free future.*
**What You’ll Get To Do**
 As a
 **Business Developer** 
 , you will drive growth by identifying business opportunities, forming strategic alliances, and securing project collaborations. You will work with industrial energy users, data centers, and energy companies to develop commercial agreements. With your business acumen and passion for clean energy, you will help deploy small modular reactors worldwide.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Business Development – Identify and secure business opportunities through partnerships with energy companies and industrial large energy user
* Financial modelling - ensure the company's evolving cost estimates are kept track of and can be translated into business models and quotes for customers
* Market Intelligence & Strategy – Conduct market research to assess market development, customer needs, and competition, translating insights into strategic recommendations.
* Proposal & Project Development – Collaborate with engineering teams to develop tailored business proposals, project plans, and feasibility studies on how to tailor Blykalla’s solution and value proposition to our key customer segments
* Industry Representation & Networking – Represent Blykalla at industry events to enhance visibility and expand professional networks.
* Internal Strategy & Advisory – Support senior management with data-driven insights on market positioning, business growth, and competitive strategy.


**Who You Are**
 You’ll be part of a skilled, can-do team that takes responsibility, gets things done, and challenges the status quo. You act with ownership, think critically, and iterate quickly.
   

  

 We value openness and psychological safety—you speak your mind while staying respectful. You thrive in uncharted territory, excited by the challenge of building something new and groundbreaking. Above all, you’re driven and optimistic, believing that another world is possible and ready to help build it.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* A bachelor’s degree in engineering, business administration, or a related field. A Master-, MBA, or advanced degree is a plus.
* Significant experience in consultative high-tech business development and experience in the energy sector is a plus, not a requirement
* Ability to deal with and shape work with a high degree of ambiguity, you prefer creating something some scratch rather than asking how things are done historically
* Proven ability to build and maintain relationships with diverse stakeholders. Strong negotiation, communication, and presentation skills are essential.
* Possess strong analytical, technical, and problem-solving skills, with the ability to break down and interpret complex market data into actionable insights.
* Thrive in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment, taking initiative to get things done. Experience in a startup or scale-up is a plus.
* Willingness to travel domestically and internationally as required.
* Fluent in Swedish and English, both spoken and written.


**Location**
 This position is based in our Stockholm office and will require travel as needed to meet with clients, and partners, and attend industry events.
   

  

**Why Blykalla?**
* Innovative Environment: Work with a team of forward-thinking professionals in a cutting-edge industry.
* Career Growth: Opportunities for professional development and advancement as we expand our operations.
* Impactful Work: Be a part of a mission-driven company dedicated to creating a sustainable future.


**Join us in our mission to create a cleaner, more sustainable future. Apply now and become a key player in revolutionizing the energy industry!**
*We encourage applicants from diverse backgrounds and are an equal-opportunity employer.*
***Note: We do not accept applications through email.***

title: Senior JavaScript Engineer
description:
**The role**
 We are looking for a passionate
 **Multiple Senior Frontend Engineers** 
 with experience working in React and JavaScript. As a member of a Cross-Functional team within the Gaming or Payment area and , you'll be responsible for designing and implementing the user interface of our web applications and integrating against the back end via REST APIs. You'll also be collaborating closely with Product Owner, other front-end developers, Architects and the rest of the team members to deliver high quality, scalable and user-friendly software solutions across different platforms.
   

  

 You will participate in design discussions with your colleagues to find great solutions to complex engineering challenges. We strongly believe in the “You Design it, You Build It, You Test It, You Run It, You Tweak It” ethos and everyone is expected to take part of the full system / development life cycle to ensure reliability and uptime of the production environment. As a Senior Engineer at Kindred, sharing knowledge and best practices with the team come natural for you and you enjoy being an engaged member of the team who support your colleagues when needed.
   

  

**Our technology stack includes**
* JavaScript and React
* CSS, UI libraries and HTML
* REST APIs
* CI/CD using Jenkins
* Micro frontend architecture
* Cypress E2E and Component Testing
* State management with Redux or similar


**To excel in this role, we believe you…**
* Have commercial experience working as a Senior Frontend Developer/Engineer, with great skills in JavaScript and React/Redux
* Have great communication skills
* Team player, has worked in an Agile team and familiar with Scrum, Kanban or similar frameworks.
* Are proficient with CSS, HTML and UI libraries.
* Have experience releasing components to production and keeping them up to date with appropriate versioning.
* Have experience in integrations with REST-API's
* Enjoy having full ownership of your work and the SDLC including using appropriate testing techniques such as unit testing & integration testing.
* Have experience implementing CI/CD practices such as git branching, automated tests and automated deployment pipelines
* Are able to investigate, troubleshoot and solve production issues, or having previous experience working as an Incident Manager
* Have good appreciation of TDD/BDD
* Have good understanding of React Hooks
* Typescript, Node JS and A/B Testing experiences are a big plus
* Service workers experience is a plus

title: Senior Backend Engineer
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**
**We are looking for Senior Backend Engineers**
 The Payments Team is focused on enhancing seamless payment experiences and subscription management while tackling the challenge of migrating from a legacy monolithic to an event-driven architecture. Through collaboration across engineering, product management, and stakeholders, we aim to optimize user journeys and drive Epidemic Sound’s growth.
   

  

 As a team, we value open collaboration, tackling complex technical challenges together, and sharing knowledge through pair and mob programming as well as regular hack weeks. Your insights will shape and influence the team’s roadmap, so we're looking for someone who thrives in a dynamic environment and embraces uncertainty.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Develop and maintain high-performance backend systems with a focus on payment and subscription services
* Design and implement REST APIs and microservices using Kotlin (Ktor) or Python (FastAPI), ensuring scalability and reliability
* Collaborate with frontend engineers, product managers, and data teams to create cohesive, impactful solutions
* Champion best practices in CI/CD, DevOps, and testing, leveraging tools like Kubernetes and Google Cloud Platform (GCP) for robust deployment pipelines
* Drive experimentation through A/B testing and growth-focused methodologies to iteratively improve user engagement and experience


**Who You Are**
* System Design Expertise: You have a solid understanding of system design principles and distributed architecture, enabling you to build scalable and reliable backend services
* Experienced Developer: You bring 5+ years of experience in backend development with expertise in Java with Kotlin or Python
* DevOps Knowledge: Familiarity with Docker, Kubernetes, Google Cloud Platform (GCP) or AWS


**Nice to Have:**
* Go
* Terraform


**Soft Skills**
* Adaptability: Quickly adjust to changing priorities and evolving technologies in a fast-paced scaleup environment
* Collaboration: Strong teamwork abilities for effective cross-functional engagement and knowledge sharing
* Problem-Solving Mindset: Proactively identify challenges and devise innovative solutions to drive progress and improve processes


**Equal Opportunity Employer:**
 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
   

  

**Application**
 Do you want to be a part of our fantastic team? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link below.
   

  

**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**

title: Senior Java developer
description:
This is a remote position.
   

  

**Job Title:** 
 Senior Java Developer
   

  

**Location:** 
 Sweden (Flexible, with offices in Stockholm
   

  

**Type:** 
 Freelance job
   

  

 About Us:
   

  

 We are a leading technology company based in Sweden, committed to developing high-quality software solutions for a diverse range of industries, including finance, healthcare, and telecommunications. As part of our ongoing growth, we are looking for a skilled
 **Senior Java Developer** 
 to join our engineering team. You’ll be working on innovative, large-scale projects that push the boundaries of technology and provide value to our customers.
   

  

 Role Overview:
   

  

 As a
 **Senior Java Developer** 
 , you will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining high-performance, scalable applications. You’ll collaborate with other senior developers, architects, product managers, and cross-functional teams to deliver top-notch software solutions. This role will involve working with modern Java technologies, cloud platforms, and continuous integration/deployment pipelines, as well as mentoring junior developers.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities:
   

  

* Design & Development: Lead the design and development of Java-based applications, ensuring they are efficient, scalable, and maintainable.
* Architecture: Work on the architecture of complex systems, implementing best practices and ensuring high availability and fault tolerance.
* Code Quality: Write clean, efficient, and reusable code; conduct code reviews and contribute to the team's best practices for coding, testing, and documentation.
* Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams including product managers, QA engineers, and DevOps to deliver integrated solutions on time.
* Mentorship: Guide and mentor junior and mid-level developers, helping them grow in their technical skills and understanding of the system architecture.
* Continuous Improvement: Proactively identify areas for performance optimization, scalability improvements, and refactoring opportunities.
* Testing & Debugging: Implement automated tests, troubleshoot and resolve production issues, and continuously improve the stability and quality of applications.
* DevOps: Contribute to the automation of the deployment pipeline using CI/CD tools and work with cloud technologies (e.g., AWS, Azure) for building scalable systems.


 Key Qualifications:
   

  

* Experience: 5+ years of hands-on experience in Java development with a strong focus on backend development.
* Technical Skills:
+ Proficiency in Java 8+, including experience with Java frameworks such as Spring Boot and Spring Cloud.
+ Deep understanding of RESTful APIs and microservices architecture.
+ Experience with databases (SQL and NoSQL), including performance tuning and query optimization.
+ Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and deployment in a cloud-native environment.
+ Experience working with message brokers (e.g., Kafka, RabbitMQ) and containerization (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
+ Understanding of Agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban) and version control tools (e.g., Git).

title: Backend / Laravel Developer
description:
Join our dev team in Stockholm and Gothenburg!
 



  





 Do you have a few years of experience, a strong focus on Backend, excited to create innovative e-commerce solutions and thrive in a client-oriented environment? Grebban could be your next adventure!
 



  





 Grebban is an e-commerce agency that works exclusively with headless solutions, which we integrate using our in-house developed APIs to be used by our frontend applications.
 



  





 In this role, you’ll be working on:
 



  




* Developing our e-commerce APIs
* Building integrations with new e-commerce systems
* Optimizing performance for APIs and databases
* As a Laravel/Backend Developer, you should have:
* Strong knowledge of PHP (ideally with frameworks such as Lumen/Laravel)
* Experience with relational databases (e.g., MySQL or PostgreSQL)



  





 Additional skills we're looking for (bonus):
 



  




* Redis/Memcache
* AWS (or other cloud solutions)
* CI/CD pipelines
* Automated testing
* CDN (e.g., Cloudflare and Cloudfront)
* Experience with e-commerce solutions



  





 To be successful in this role we believe you are:
 



  




* Effective in communications. You lead people and communicate great with people, internally and externally, keeping everyone on the same page.
* Friendly, flexible, and a pragmatic problem-solver.
* Value company culture and enjoy a social workplace.
* An experienced developer with a background of working in similar environments within e-commerce and agency.
* A friendly face in the team, offering a helping hand and sharing knowledge to keep motivation and productivity high.
* Fast-paced and understand the importance of getting things done.
* We value the right mindset and talent over formal credentials.
* Fluent in communication in English and Swedish, both written and verbal.



  





 What we offer:
 



  




* The opportunity to work on exciting projects with leading brands
* Competitive benefits, including biannual salary reviews, a generous pension plan, wellness allowances, remote work flexibility, and state-of-the-art equipment
* A fast-paced, fun, and supportive team with a collaborative culture
* A flexible, modern working structure with autonomous teams and predictable sprint cycles
* Continuous skill development opportunities through internal task forces, external conferences, and more
* Plenty of opportunities to grow, whether you want to advance as a specialist or develop into a leadership role
* The chance to work with brands that inspire you
* Depending on your seniority, we are open to fully remote work, part-time onsite, or fully onsite work at our offices in Stockholm or Gothenburg.



  





 About us:
 



  





 Grebban develops brands and designs e-commerce experiences for committed and ambitious clients around the world. We are one of the most sought-after agencies in Europe, working primarily with brands seeking long-term partnerships. We have a very high success rate in creating significant business value for our clients.
 



  





 As e-commerce specialists, we guide our clients to get the best outcomes in their most critical sales channels. Our services include brand design, growth strategies, UX and digital design, system architecture, and building state-of-the-art e-commerce solutions. We are headless experts, primarily working with platforms like Centra, Norce, and Shopify Plus. Some of Grebban’s clients include J.Lindeberg, Björn Borg, Djerf Avenue, iDeal of Sweden, Kari-Traa, Hestra, NN07, Filippa K, and Sandqvist.
 



  





 Interested?
 



  





 We’re always eager to meet developers who want to be part of our team. If you’re passionate about backend development and have a client-first approach, send us your application! Let’s explore how you can contribute to our exciting projects at Grebban.
 



  





 \*Immediate availability for this role is advantageous.

title: Java Developer (R-17335)
description:
**Why We Work at Dun & Bradstreet**
 Dun & Bradstreet combines global data and local expertise to help clients make smarter decisions. With 6,000+ people in 31 countries, we are a team of diverse thinkers and problem solvers who all share a common curiosity: to find new ways to turn data into value. If you share this curiosity and want to be part of a future-ready company, come join us! Learn more at dnb.com/careers .
   

  

**The role**
 We are looking for an experienced Java Developer to join our team in Sweden. We maintain and develop several business-critical applications built on Java, .NET, and SQL Server. As we move toward a unified, modern architecture in Java and AWS, we need a help to drive technical improvements, support the team, and promote best practices in software development and agile collaboration.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Hands-On Development: Design, build, and refactor systems into containerized microservices running in cloud.
* Handle critical maintenance & support in both modern and legacy: Handle incidents in production systems with technical investigations and solutions.
* Drive Modernization: Contribute to the strategy and execution of transforming legacy applications into modern cloud solutions.
* Support the Team: Share knowledge, promote modern software development practices, and encourage team collaboration.
* Advocate for Best Practices: Implement clean code principles, CI/CD pipelines, and containerization (Docker).


**Skills**
* Technical Expertise:
* Around 5 years of experience with Java and microservices development.
* Exposure to legacy systems (e.g., .NET and relational databases like SQL Server, Postgres, MongoDB).
* Proficiency with Docker and experience building containerized applications.
* Familiarity with Spring Boot framework and AWS cloud services.
* Well-oriented and comfortable working on Linux on-prem servers.
* Team and Collaboration:
* Ability to work effectively in a team environment, sharing knowledge and supporting colleagues.
* Experience working with agile processes and a collaborative mindset.
* Mindset:
* Passion for system modernization, solving technical challenges and improving processes.
* Willingness to bridge the gap between legacy systems and modern software solutions.
* Fluent in both English and Swedish language


**Why Join Us?**
**Benefits**
 Does this role sound like a great opportunity but you’re not sure about making a move? We are really proud of our company and culture and think we have some great things to offer. Some of our benefits in Sweden include:
   

  

* Two paid volunteer days to contribute to causes in your community
* A paid day every year to use for your health and wellness
* Instead of half days before public holidays, you will have 4 additional full days a year for you to use to celebrate what is meaningful to you
* Annual wellness/sport benefit
* Collective agreement, pension, insurance and parental pay allowance
* Access to free services providing support and counselling
* Flexible working arrangements and hybrid work arrangement for most roles


**New Office Location**
 Our office is currently located in Solna, however we are very excited to be moving to a beautiful new location in central Stockholm at the end of 2025. Our future address will be Fleminggatan 14 in Kungsholmen, just a short walk from Stockholm Central Station.
   

  

***Whilst some roles do have certain requirements which are essential, we try to focus on hiring based on potential rather than CV as much as possible. If you are unsure you fully meet the requirements, we would still love to hear from you!***
 All Dun & Bradstreet job postings can be found at https://www.dnb.com/about-us/careers-and-people/joblistings.html and https://jobs.lever.co/dnb . Official communication from Dun & Bradstreet will come from an email address ending in @dnb.com.
   

  

 Notice to Applicants : Please be advised that this job posting page is hosted and powered by Lever. Your use of this page is subject to Lever's Privacy Notice and Cookie Policy , which governs the processing of visitor data on this platform.

title: D365 F&O Developer - Sweden
description:
Role Overview (FREELANCE):
   

  

 As a
 **D365 F&O Developer** 
 , you will play a critical role in the development, customization, and integration of the Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations (F&O) system. You will work closely with functional consultants, business analysts, and stakeholders to deliver solutions that support our finance, supply chain, and operations processes. Your work will ensure that our D365 F&O system is optimized, scalable, and aligned with the organization’s strategic goals.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities:
   

  

* Design, develop, and implement custom solutions within the D365 F&O environment, including modules such as finance, supply chain, procurement, and manufacturing.
* Collaborate with business stakeholders and functional consultants to understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
* Develop X++ code, custom reports, batch jobs, and workflows within Dynamics 365 F&O.
* Integrate D365 F&O with other internal and third-party systems using data entities, OData, and web services.
* Customize and extend existing D365 F&O features to meet business needs, ensuring high performance and reliability.
* Participate in system testing, debugging, and troubleshooting to resolve issues and enhance system functionality.
* Ensure that development adheres to best practices, and that code is maintainable, reusable, and scalable.
* Contribute to system documentation, including design, technical specifications, and user guides.
* Participate in system upgrades, patches, and migrations to ensure the D365 F&O system is always up-to-date.
* Provide post-implementation support and troubleshooting for D365 F&O users.


 Key Qualifications:
   

  

* Experience: 3+ years of experience working with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations (F&O) development.
* Technical Skills:
+ Proficiency in X++ programming and development for D365 F&O.
+ Solid understanding of Dynamics 365 F&O modules, especially finance, supply chain, procurement, and inventory management.
+ Experience with integration using Data Management, OData, and REST APIs.
+ Familiarity with Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate) and Azure integration is a plus.
+ Understanding of SQL Server, SSRS, and reporting tools used in the Dynamics 365 ecosystem.
+ Experience with ALM (Application Lifecycle Management) processes in Dynamics 365.

title: Mobile SDK Developer
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 We are a forward-thinking team creating cutting-edge, cloud-based communication solutions. Our mobile client SDKs are key to how our customers integrate their products with our platform. We have clients ranging from small businesses to large enterprises, and their mobile apps are used by millions of people worldwide. By developing our voice and video SDKs together with the team, you will play a pivotal role in powering all those real-time conversations.
   

  

**Role**
 As a Mobile SDK Engineer, you'll take ownership of developing and maintaining high-performing mobile SDKs while contributing to all stages of the software lifecycle. In this role, you will:
   

  

* Develop SDKs using WebRTC technology to optimize real-time communication features.
* Work with the team to align SDK APIs and features across multiple platforms, including iOS, Android, and Web/JavaScript.
* Develop cross-platform solutions using a C++ codebase shared between iOS and Android.
* Design APIs with simplicity in mind while maintaining modularity, extensibility, and API stability over time.
* Write clean, testable, and maintainable code, with a focus on system performance and scalability.
* Enhance automation, streamline CI/CD pipelines, and troubleshoot issues proactively.
* Influence architectural decisions and actively contribute to enhancing our development and operational practices.


**Requirements**
* Professional expertise in modern C++, especially in mobile applications development.
* Professional experience developing for the iOS and/or Android platform.
* Experience with at least one of Kotlin or Objective-C/Swift.
* Experience working in Linux/macOS development environments and CI pipelines.
* Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset.
* A passion for clean, testable code and modern software practices.


**Good to have**
* Experience with WebRTC protocols and NAT traversal, including ICE, STUN, and TURN, is a significant advantage.
* Experience developing software libraries and/or SDKs consumed by other developers.
* In-depth knowledge of network protocols such as IP, TCP, UDP, and DNS.
* Great debugging and troubleshooting skills.


 Embrace the challenge and join us! You will have the chance to:
   

  

* Work with a talented and diverse team in a culture that values innovation and collaboration.
* Take on meaningful challenges and grow with the latest technologies.
* Enjoy flexibility with remote work options and a healthy work-life balance.
* Benefit from competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package, including healthcare insurance, pension contributions, and wellness allowance.


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: . No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Product Designer H&M Baby Girls Woven and Knitwear - 1-year Temporary position
description:
**Job Description**
 Do you have a great passion for the Baby Girls customer? Are you excited to join us on our ambitious journey creating the best ever Baby Girls Woven and Knitwear collections? These are fast-growing product groups and the customers love our fashionable, cute, playful and creative offer! We now look for you with the passion and ability to take the collections to the next level. Come work in our supportive, positive and creative team where the sky is the limit!
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
 As Product Designer you are responsible for designing and developing collections for our Baby Girls customer (6months-2years old). You will work with woven, knitwear and denim products like blouses, skirts, trousers, cardigans, sweaters and more. You work closely with the whole team including a junior designer, product developer, pattern maker etc, as well as with production in developing the collection towards all our global markets and selling channels.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 We look for a driven product designer with a true passion for the Baby customer. You are positive, energetic, creative, and playful with a great eye for upcoming fashion trends for this customer group. You will contribute with updated fashion insights with fresh ideas, energy, creativity and a fully global perspective. We look for a team player with formal or informal leadership skills and abilities. You can prioritize well and work independently with many stakeholders and collaborators to varied time lines at a high pace.
   

  

**You need to have:**
* BA/MA degree in Fashion Design
* A minimum of 2-3 years’ work experience as a product designer or a very experienced junior designer
* Strong skills in Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, CLO 3D and preferably PLM system/s
* A passion for and commercial understanding of the Baby customer and trends
* Team player thriving working in a diverse setting where you contribute with your own perspectives
* Organized, structured and efficient working at high pace in an ever-changing work environment
* Inspiring and clear communicator
* Very driven with high ability to take own initiatives and decision making, preferably with formal or informal leadership work experience
* English fluency (Swedish not necessary)


**Additional Information**
 This is a full time 1-year maternity leave starting May 2025, working at our H&M Head office in Stockholm. If this sounds interesting and you fit the qualifications,
 **apply by 16th February** 
 with updated CV and portfolio work (pdf max 10mb/uploaded document). The portfolio should include vision/mood boards, full design process and final collections showing products from a variety of relevant fashion design projects. All documents should be in English.
   

  

 At H&M Group we strive to have a fair and inclusive recruitment process. Therefor we kindly ask you to
 **not** 
 attach any cover letter or email in your application as they often contain information that could trigger unintentional biases
 **.** 
***If you are currently employed within the H&M Group:** 
 please remember to communicate with your closest manager when applying, and if you are currently permanently employed you will keep this status even if taking on this temporarily role.*
**Benefits**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here
 *In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.*
**Inclusion & Diversity**
*At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organization. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experiences and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.*
**Company Description**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way.
   

  

**We look forward to hearing from you**

title: Software Architect
company_industry: Financial Services and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
*Genom snabb och säker digital identifiering möjliggör vi ett modernt och tillgängligt samhälle.* 




  





 Finansiell ID-Teknik är företaget bakom BankID, Sveriges mest använda lösning för digital identifiering och underskrift. Idag använder över 8 miljoner svenskar BankID och flertalet myndigheter, banker och andra företag har BankID i sina e-tjänster. Vår ledstjärna är säkerhet och i alla lägen säkrar vi användarnas identitet och integritet. Vi är en liten organisation med stor kompetens och ett samhällsviktigt uppdrag. Här jobbar vi nära tillsammans för att tillhandahålla säker, snabb och tillgänglig digital identifiering och underskrift till det svenska samhället. Vårt kontor finns i centrala Stockholm.
 



  





**Om tjänsten** 




  





 Som Software Architect ansvarar du tillsammans med arkitekturteamet för att planera, utveckla och utforma vår arkitektur på ett sätt som stödjer verksamhetens affärsmål och strategi.
 



  





 Rollen innebär att ta ansvar för helhetsperspektivet av vår arkitektur, stötta övriga i teamet att förstå och diskutera systemarkitektur, arbeta fram och underhålla referensarkitektur och molnbaserad arkitektur samt säkerställa att vi följer gemensam teknikpraxis.
 



  





 I arbetsuppgifterna ingår bland annat att översätta affärskrav till tekniska krav, planera teknikskiften och teknikförbättringar samt delta och driva utredningar för teknikval. Du kommer dessutom ha en viktig roll i att bevaka vår omvärld för att se till att vi håller oss relevanta och konkurrenskraftiga på marknaden.
 



  





**Är det här du?** 




  





 För att lyckas i rollen som Software Architect behöver du ha relevant akademisk utbildning och mångårig erfarenhet av utvecklarrollen och systemarkitektur eller lösningsarkitektur. Du har förmodligen jobbat som Lead eller senior Developer. Du har jobbat med transaktionsintensiva system med höga krav på säkerhet och tillgänglighet, och är redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär. Du har förståelse för arkitekturval och hur de påverkar systemet och organisationen. Du är trygg med att framföra komplexa lösningar på ett begripligt sätt.
 



  





 Utöver det har du erfarenhet av att arbeta fram och underhålla referensarkitektur samt förståelse för arkitektval och hur de påverkar. Du har tidigare arbetat tvärfunktionellt och är trygg med att framföra komplexa lösningar på ett begripligt sätt samt har en god förmåga att dokumentera ditt arbete.
 



  





 Det är fördelaktigt om du har erfarenhet av Java och/eller Go.
 



  





 Vi fäster stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper och söker dig som är positiv, lösningsorienterad och kommunikativ. Vi ser gärna att du är strukturerad, har ett metodiskt arbetssätt samt besitter en god analytisk förmåga. Det är viktigt att du har tålamod att driva långsiktiga frågor förmågan att tydligt förmedla information i både tal och skrift på svenska och engelska. Vidare är du prestigelös och trygg med en god fingertoppskänsla samt trivs som bäst när du arbetar tillsammans med andra.
 



  





**Om oss** 




  





 På BankID drivs vi av att bidra till samhällskritisk infrastruktur som är till stor nytta för många människor. Det gör vi som ett team och vår strävan är att hela tiden att bli bättre tillsammans. Inkluderande samarbeten är en förutsättning för att nå högt engagemang och goda resultat. Vi strävar efter att både egna medarbetare och leverantörer vi samarbetar med ska känna sig som del av ett team med gemensamma mål.
 



  





 Vi är ett ”Great place to work”-certifierat bolag. ”Great Place to work” definierar en utmärkt arbetsplats så här: ”En utmärkt arbetsplats är en där man litar på människorna man arbetar för, känner stolthet för det man gör och trivs med människorna man jobbar tillsammans med.
 



  





 Läs gärna mer om oss i vår hållbarhetsrapport: https://www.bankid.com/assets/bankid/files/hallbarhetsrapport\_2022\_webb.pdf
 



  





**Vill du veta mer?** 




  





 I denna rekrytering samarbetar BankID med Level Recruitment. Vänligen sök tjänsten genom att klicka på "ansök"-knappen här intill. Vid frågor vänligen kontakta Senior Rekryteringskonsult Lynn Sjöberg Westander på 08-120 50 431. Urvalet av ansökningar sker löpande. Välkommen in med din ansökan!

title: Senior Software Developer- Python & C++
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Information Services
description:
**We are looking for a talented "Senior Software Developer" to join a global automotive company in Södertälje, Stockholm. Start ASAP, 6 month's limited contract to begin with.** 




  





**Role Description:** 




 The team is responsible for all onboard data collection and offloading from our autonomous vehicles, and we need a skilled individual to help us continue our innovative work.
 



  




* Required a highly skilled developer who has at least five years of experience working on mid to large-size projects.
* The ideal candidate should have expertise in software development using Python and C++, along with a strong knowledge of CI/CD, GitLab, and AWS.
* Understanding of Docker and Network basics is also essential for this role. Additionally, experience or skills in Linux, ARM, and frontend development would be a great bonus, though they are not mandatory.
* Finally, the candidate should be proficient in English, Swedish is not essential.



  





 This is a full-time consultant position through Incluso in Stockholm. Start ASAP, 6 Month's limited contract to begin with, possibility of extension.
 



  





 Please submit your CV as soon as possible since we will review the applications on an on-going basis.
 



  





 For more information about this role, please contact Kanika Singhal, recruiter at Incluso.

title: Competence Developer Technical Training, Scania Academy
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

 In Scania´s journey to become the leader in sustainable transport solutions, Scania Academy supports the business to develop top employees. We enable all employees to perform at their best by providing solutions that increase and secure the right competences, behaviours and attitudes to reach the business targets.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 Do you have a genuine technical interest and want to influence by developing new learning objects, methods and strengthening the competence of our customers? Then you have an excellent opportunity to join our team.
   

  

 Scania Academy is a trusted partner for the global organisation in competence development. Our mission is to support the organisation in identifying skills needs, offering methods and tools for competence development and strengthen the results.
   

  

 Our mission as a trusted partner to our demanding customers is to support them with efficient training solutions, with high quality and at the right time, to secure the technical competencies needed now and in the future. We know that we are facing several future challenges when it comes to a more complex product, decreased lead time, digital methods and new behaviours. Now you have the opportunity to join us on this journey into the future.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
 In the role as a Competence Developer for Technical Training you are, together with our customer, responsible to efficiently develop and deliver technical training solutions for the global network.
   

  

 The learning methods we use are both hands-on training and more digital methods where we deliver technical seminars from our own studio to the network. We are also at the forefront of developing learning methods that include virtual reality.
   

  

 To identify good examples of technical training and to quality assure our own training materials, international travel may be required.
   

  

**Who You Are**
* As a person you have a strong mindset with the ability to challenge, innovate and improve processes. You need to have great social skills and the ability to work independently and collaboratively in different teams.
* In the role you will meet people from many different cultures so it is a an advantage if you have previous cultural experiences.
* We also believe that you are a practical person with an interest in mechanics and electrical/digital systems.
* The development in the automotive industry is moving at a rapid pace, so it is essential that you have a driven and determined mindset to be able to evolve with the business. To be able to communicate different learning solutions you need to have strong pedagogical skills. It is a great advantage if you have been a technical trainer or similar.
* The most important factor to be able to succeed in this role, is however to be curious about new technologies and eager to learn.
* You are fluent in English , both in speech and in writing. Swedish is not a requirement but it is a merit.


**This Is Us**
 In Scania´s journey to become the leader in sustainable transport solutions, Scania Academy supports the business to develop top employees. We enable all employees to perform at their best by providing solutions that increase and secure the right competences, behaviours and attitudes to reach the business targets.
   

  

**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-02-20. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:
   

  

 Håkan Axelsson, Manager Of Technical Training Development HACD, hakan.axelsson@scania.com
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: Data Scientist & Startup Founder (March 2025)
job_function: Information Technology, Business Development, and Strategy/Planning
company_industry: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals
description:
**This ad is not for an employment, but an opportunity to build a VC-backed startup from the ground up.** 




  





**Who you are:** 




 You are a highly skilled technical professional with a proven track record in developing innovative solutions. Your strong programming abilities and experience in building complex algorithms enable you to address critical challenges within the tech industry. You are a proactive individual with a passion for progress, driven to make a significant impact through cutting-edge technological advancements.
 



  





**The Antler Founder Residency** 




 Join a dynamic cohort of 200+ highly motivated entrepreneurs for an immersive 12-week program. Visit our website for a detailed breakdown of how we'll support your startup launch.
 


* 12-Week full-time Immersive Journey: Kicking off March, 2025, in Stockholm.
* Co-Founder Discovery: In the first 10 weeks, collaborate with fellow Founders to find your co-founder(s).
* Pitch to Invest: Present your team and business idea to the Antler Investment Committee. Secure a net cash investment of EUR 100k for 10% equity.
* Accelerate Growth: If funded, we work closely with you to make your startup a success!



  





**Program Details** 



* **Start Date:** 
 March 3rd, 2025
* **Location:** 
 Onsite at our Stockholm office
* **Compensation:** 
 While participants don't receive financial compensation during the program, pre-seed investment is available to jumpstart your venture.
* **Visa Sponsorship:** 
 Due to the non-employment nature of the program, visa sponsorship is unavailable.



  





**For our March 2025 cohort, we're looking for someone who:** 



* Excel in Data Science, Machine Learning, or AI, with a knack for advancing technology.
* Can unearth insights from intricate data, leading in ML methodologies.
* Embrace the challenge of merging diverse data for revolutionary models.
* Are adept at prototyping innovative solutions that pave the way for real-world applications.
* Navigate product development with strategic foresight and precision.
* Experienced in the start-up ecosystem
* Optional: have an idea that solves a problem you’re passionate about, but you understand the need for co-pilots who share your vision and values



  





**Application Process** 




 Our streamlined application process takes only 2-3 weeks:
 


1. Apply through our website.
2. Participate in an introductory interview.
3. Progress to an in-depth interview with our partners.
4. Receive a potential offer.



  





**Meet Our Nordic Success Stories:** 



* **Wingbits:** 
 A community-driven flight data tracking platform
* **Two:** 
 A comprehensive B2B payment suite simplifying sales for online and offline businesses.
* **Evyon:** 
 A developer of eco-friendly battery energy storage systems.
* **Glint Solar:** 
 Software accelerating identification of optimal solar installation sites.
* **PerPlant:** 
 AI-powered sensor systems creating a gateway to sustainable agriculture.

title: Function Developer for brake systems
description:
Are you a team player with a great interest in technology? Do you have both a structured mind and a big chunk of creativity? This is an opportunity to join our team, Brake Function!
   

  

 As sustainable and autonomous transport solutions are parts of Scania´s future we are ramping up to meet the challenges ahead. With the increased number of projects and initiatives affecting the brake system, we see a need to increase our capability in the development of the brake system and its function.
   

  

 Our group is involved from concept development to realization, including testing and verification of brake systems in the vehicle. Our responsibilities cover functions that play a significant role in safety, stability, driveability, and brake performance. The team members have deep knowledge and experience within the brake system and consist of both engineers and mechanics.
   

  

**Your role**
 As a Function Developer within brake systems and functions, you will together with a team of experienced colleagues develop, test, and validate brake functionality on trucks and buses within the Traton group. This also involves defining requirements, programming, testing in vehicle and rig as well as making safety analyses.
   

  

 Contact with external suppliers is common and cooperation cross-functional within Traton takes place on daily basis.
   

  

**Your profile**
 You have a genuine interest in technology and put the customers’ needs in focus. We believe it is important that you are a team player and someone with a collaborative mind set.
   

  

 You have a Master's or Bachelor's degree and probably a few years of work experience within a relevant field. Newly graduates with a suiting orientation are welcome to apply, although work experience in product development and testing within systems development is desirable. You need to have at least intermediate skills in C-programming, and advanced skills in Matlab and Simulink and you probably have an understanding of CAN bus and tools such as Vector CANalyzer/CANape.
   

  

 It is desirable that you have a driver's license for heavy trucks (C/CE) or are willing to take one.
   

  

 At Scania, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles! We hire for attitude and train for skills.
   

  

**What We Can Offer You**
 As a Scania employee, you have an almost endless variety of future professional development opportunities and great colleagues and within Brake Function you will have the possibility to be part of – and shape - our future journey.
   

  

 We can offer you a dynamic workplace with diverse and challenging tasks in a hybrid work setup, meaning you can work from home a few days a week if the job allows.
