* Flytande svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift samt B-körkort.


 Det är meriterande om du har relevant akademisk utbildning eller motsvarande erfarenhet.
   

  

**Placeringsort**
 Iver finns på 25 platser i Sverige och Norge för denna tjänst söker vi någon till Stockholm eller Malmö.
   

  

 Välkommen att söka rollen som Business Development Manager inom SMB!
   

  

 Urval sker löpande, tjänsten kan tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag. Iver eftersträvar en jämn könsfördelning och värdesätter etnisk och kulturell mångfald. Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. Sista ansökningsdag är 2025-02-23.. Du är välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Jim Qvarfordt på (jim.qvarfordt@iver.se) vid eventuella frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**We empower our Nordic society** 
 . Iver är en ledande nordisk helhetsleverantör av molnbaserade IT-tjänster med spetskompetens inom drift, cybersäkerhet, cloud och innovation.
   

  

**Våra tjänster är kritiska inte bara för våra kunder – utan för digitaliseringen av samhället i stort.** 
 Vi säkerställer att sjukvården har tillgång till rätt patientdata, att samhällskritiska system aldrig ligger nere och att flygplanen landar säkert. Som en lyhörd och affärsnära helhetspartner möjliggör vi våra kunders innovation – idag och imorgon.

title: Associate Operations Manager - Strategy & Operations
description:
**Job Description**
 Join a forward-leaning and agilent team at Wolt as an Associate Operations Manager in region North!
   

  

 As an Associate Operations Manager in the Regional Strategy & Operations team, you will be responsible for driving innovation, implementation and execution across all aspects of our operations. This particular role will have a major focus on leading our ambitions to make autonomous deliveries a natural part of our operations across the region. It will also include working with other key areas and challenging problems while spearheading the innovation for new ideas; whether it is a new courier partnership model, a new sustainability project or a new delivery mode all together. In this, you will be responsible for bringing structure to ambiguous situations and own the forward progress. You will collaborate across individuals, teams and functions, bringing your natural knack for ownership, execution and problem-solving.
   

  

 Reporting directly to the Regional Head of Strategy & Innovation as part of Regional Operations, your role is crucial in achieving ambitious targets in all countries and all business lines that we operate in.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 This is a multi-faced and highly varied role, but the major areas of responsibilities including tasks are:
   

  

* Own the operational part of autonomous deliveries - incl. vision & strategy, partnership negotiations, feasibility studies, unit economics, product development coordination and scale-up of operations.
* Identify and suggest new business and project opportunities within the scope Strategy & Innovation, based on industry insights and data driven hypotheses
* Utilize your analytical skills to create data driven hypotheses of how to solve complex problems involving all sides of the Wolt platform and business environment.
* Lead and own responsibility areas in focus that you oversee from ideation to implementation and follow-up, with the potential of leading a team in the future
* Effectively collaborate with internal and external stakeholders across all functions of the company to ensure progress for your specific responsibility areas including but not limited to product, marketing, legal, policy, local and global business teams.
* Monitor KPIs and conduct analysis to unpack why performance is what it is and devising strategies to meet or exceed the targets for region North


**Our humble expectations**
* Strong sense of ownership and accountability for end results
* Experience from operational autonomy development and implementation
* Proactive "doer" mentality, with willingness to fail and open to learn from mistakes
* Self-driven and able to fill your own and team members’ work weeks with tasks, based on agreed purposes and end-states for the direction of the team and the company
* Solves problems independently and proactively
* Experienced manager, that has led both big and small projects and teams before with successful, measurable results
* Passionate about new technology and innovative ways to operate
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English (Nordic languages fluency is a plus)
* Proficient in digital collaboration tools like GSuite, Slack, and Zoom


**Next Steps**
 If you have any further questions about the position before submitting an application, you can turn to:
   

  

 Laura Ilioaea - Talent Acquisition Partner
   

  

 laura.ilioaea@external.wolt.com
   

  

 Please note that we do not accept applications coming in via email. Please submit your application in English via our career page.
   

  

 This role does not include relocation assistance. If you are applying from abroad, you will need to be fully prepared to handle all aspects of your relocation independently, including securing work authorization (if applicable) and covering relocation expenses.
   

  

**About Wolt**
 Wolt is a Helsinki-based technology company that provides an online platform for consumers, merchants and couriers. It connects people looking to order food and other goods with people interested in selling and delivering them. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local logistics to retail software and financial solutions – as well as operating its own grocery stores under the Wolt Market brand. Wolt’s products include Wolt+ (subscription service for customers), Wolt for Work (meal benefits and office deliveries for companies), Wolt Drive (fast last-mile deliveries for merchants) and Wolt Self-Delivery (service for merchant partners with their own delivery staff). Wolt’s mission is to make cities better by empowering and growing local communities. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. DoorDash operates in 29 countries today, 25 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.
   

  

**So, why work at Wolt?**
**At Wolt, We’re About Getting Things Done.**
 You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.
   

  

 We work hard to make cities into better places, and it’s pretty cool seeing us grow every week. If you’re passionate about building things that just… work, Wolt might be for you.
   

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion**
 We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.
   

  

***Join us today to build Wolt together.***

title: Principal Solution Architect
description:
Ready to contribute meaningfully to AstraZeneca's digital transformation? Join us as a Principal Solution Architect and be at the heart of developing innovative solutions that drive our business capabilities forward. In this empowering role, you will help craft our digital journey to align with AstraZeneca's IT strategy, roadmap, principles, and standards.
   

  

**Location** 
 : Södertälje, Sweden - Home to our Largest Manufacturing Site
   

  

**Why This Role?**
 You will guide architectural design and innovation within AstraZeneca’s Quality Assurance and Quality Control areas globally (30+ Sites). Driven by a passion for enhancing Digital Laboratory and Manufacturing, your efforts will support moving us towards our ‘Lab of the Future’ ambitions that will make a positive impact on the patients our medicines treat. Collaborating closely with fellow architects and tech. professionals, you will help navigate the digital transformation of our operations, making a meaningful contribution to significant projects.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Design and govern solutions within AstraZeneca’s strategic IT landscape to support progressive business projects.
* Collaborate across multi-functional teams, encouraging relationships that ensure a secure and compliant environment.
* Define the roadmap for our future landscape and encourage meaningful change by bringing fresh ideas and approaches.


**Essential Skills/Experience:**
* Deep knowledge and experience in thoughtfully developing and maintaining business solution architectures within established frameworks.
* Exceptional ability to influence and communicate, particularly between business and IT, along with a supportive approach to vendor management.
* Experienced in thoughtfully advising diverse, multi-functional teams and gently guiding product evaluations and business case developments.


**Desirable Skills/Experience:**
* Highly proactive with a customer-centred mindset, welcoming and valuing cross-cultural perspectives.
* Background in nurturing talent and providing mentorship.
* Familiar with a range of laboratory platforms and technologies, including Chromatography Data Systems, Laboratory Information Systems, and AI/ML.
* Architecture certifications like TOGAF and foundation in cyber security.
* Understanding of trends in the pharmaceutical and healthcare industry.


 AstraZeneca is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse environment, encouraging applicants of all backgrounds to apply. Join us in shaping the future of healthcare, where your ideas and innovations can truly make a difference.

title: Enterprise arkitekt Applikationsarkitektur
description:
Vill du vara med på Skatteverkets resa och bidra till den digitala transformationen? Vi förstärker arkitekturområdet och söker nu en erfaren Enterprise Arkitekt som har tidigare erfarenhet från snabbrörliga och komplexa it-landskap. Som EA har du ett helhetstänk och kan även tänka dig att stötta andra områden med din kompetens. Var med och gör samhället möjligt!
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Som EA med applikationsfokus och del av Skatteverkets arkitekturstyrning är du en nyckelperson i arbetet runt målarkitektur och den förflyttning Skatteverket gör mot en informationsdriven och digitaliserad verksamhet. Du bidrar med att ta fram nya lösningar som möter dagens och framtidens krav från både verksamhet och våra kunders behov.
   

  

 Skatteverket använder SAFe som agilt ramverk och arbetar i agila utvecklingsvärdeströmmar. Du kommer att jobba nära systemarkitekter och utvecklingsteam så att de kan tillämpa och realisera mål- och konceptarkitekturen men du ska också kunna stötta business owners och ledning i mål- och strategiarbete.
   

  

 Vi förväntar oss att du har kunskap om den senaste tekniken, som t ex mikrotjänster, container-tekniken och du tar fram nya arkitekturkoncept baserat på verksamhetsförmågor och dina rekommendationer.
   

  

 Skatteverkets it-verksamhet och tekniska miljö är bred. Vi förflyttar oss stegvis över till nya moderna miljöer, med molnlösningar, micro-services och container teknik. Skatteverkets it-avdelning är en av Sveriges största med närmare 1200 medarbetare som ansvarar för utveckling, drift och förvaltning av Skatteverkets it-landskap.
   

  

 Du ansvar för övergripande applikationsarkitektur inom Skatteverket och ska stödja andra enterprise arkitekter och systemarkitekter inom Skatteverket. Du bidrar med att ta fram nya lösningar som möter dagens och framtidens krav från både verksamhet och våra kunders behov. Du kommer framförallt jobba i Skatteverkets övergripande EA team som där vi har en mix av kompetens inom verksamhet/information/it och säkerhet som skall stödja vår ledning och chefsarkitekter.
   

  

 Du kommer tillhöra Arkitekturenheten på it-avdelningen.
   

  

 Jobba med it hos oss
   

  

**Om dig**
 För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. I arbetet är gott omdöme och förståelse för rättssäkerhet och säkerhet viktigt. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.
   

  

 I det här jobbet ska du:
   

  

* vara målfokuserad och bidra till att syftet med verksamheten uppnås
* ha god problemlösningsförmåga, se mönster och kunna göra avgränsningar
* god ledarskapsförmåga
* ha förmåga att se helheten och presentera information som är relevant i sammanhanget
* ha god samarbetsförmåga, vara hjälpsam och ha ett gott bemötande
* ha förmågan och viljan att lära dig nya saker, vara flexibel och kunna ställa om vid förändringar
* kunna utrycka dig väl i tal och skrift på svenska.


 Du ska även ha:
   

  

* flerårig aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av applikationsarkitektur på enterprisenivå i en stor komplex it-miljö inom en stor organisation
* aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av tjänstebaserad arkitektur
* flerårig aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av att använda modeller för att analysera och dokumentera arkitektur
* relevant erfarenhet av leda och stötta andra arkitekter och ha erfarenhet av att leda workshops
* aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av planering och genomförande av arkitekturarbete i samband med en verksamhetsförändring.


 Det är önskvärt att du har erfarenhet av agil utveckling, med ramverk SAFe.
   

  

 Det är även önskvärt att du arbetat i med applikationsutveckling kopplat till en hybrid molnleveransmodell och arbetat med AI tillämpningar.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Anställningen är tillsvidare och kan inledas med provanställning i sex månader.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, fördelarna med att jobba hos oss och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.
   

  

 När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Sundbyberg | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/26 | Kontakt: Nicole Mattsson, Hr-specialist nicole.mattsson@skatteverket.se, Mats Gidlund, Rekryterande chef mats.gidlund@skatteverket.se, | Facklig företrädare: Jeanette Forsgren, ST jeanette.forsgren@skatteverket.se, Göran Sundwall, Saco goran.sundwall@skatteverket.se, | Publicerat: 2025-02-05 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-03-05

title: Group Manager - Testing, Design & Process Support
description:
Servant Leader for software development teams with close collaboration with R&D
   

  

 Scania is currently undergoing an exciting transformation from a traditional truck manufacturer to a provider of complete sustainable transport solutions. IT is a crucial part of this transformation as Scania’s success is depending on flexible and efficient IT solutions that support current and future business requirements.
   

  

 Servant leadership is what we believe will lead our teams to success. A servant leader at Scania IT directs and motivates through why and what, lets goals be set by individuals and teams and involves everyone in decision making. A servant leader sets up business objectives and key results based on prototyping and experimentation and interacts face to face. Transparency is promoted and information is made available. Ideas are embraced and the people are loved and trusted.
   

  

 Is this your mindset and your natural way of working as a leader? Then you might be the one we are looking for!
   

  

 Your role
   

  

 Testing Enablement within Product development IT, develop and maintain applications that are needed in Scanias testing and test vehicle process. The applications are utilized in various parts of the prototype testing process, from material planning of prototype parts to evaluation of test data of prototype vehicles. Our applications uses new technologies and scalability to reach our global users and meeting their expectations.
   

  

 In this role, you will work tightly together with R&D in our cross-functional value stream.
   

  

 Your responsibilities
   

  

 In this role, you will support your development teams, help them grow, remove obstacles, and enable them to become high-performing. Additionally, you will:
   

  

  

* Engage your teams to be in touch with their end-users to understand their needs.
* Build trust and relationships within the whole value stream and act as your teams' ambassador across all of Scania.
* Create a team climate where innovation is a given factor and where ways of working can develop and continuously improve.
* Motivate, engage, and develop the people in your teams.
* Drive the development to ensure great collaboration and efficient ways of working between your local and distributed, diversified teams.
* Be a member of the section’s leadership.


 Your profile
   

  

 Empowering agile software development with a focus on creating value for the end-user is your passion!
   

  

 You live and agree with these statements picked from our Culture:
   

  

  

* Leadership instead of Management – Because success is all about growing others
* Diversity – We respect different opinions and perspectives. They are a source of great ideas
* Fun – We take having fun and being happy very seriously at work
* Our Products – We understand our end-user and fulfill needs with a solution-oriented spirit
* Elimination of Waste – Always challenge stupid things everywhere!


 As a humble, engaged, and experienced leader, you have an enthusiasm for developing people and creating high-performing development teams. Keen to understand the challenges of our end-users and the products we develop, you believe in team-based work and encourage experiments. Innovative ideas excite you, and you try them out in short iterations to create learnings, continuously adjusting based on the outcome while appreciating creativity and enthusiasm.
   

  

 Understanding that knowledge is crucial for our business, you continuously learn and improve your knowledge, creating a climate where people can grow and nourish their skills.
   

  

 You have been part of the agile software development process, so you truly understand the challenges of a development team. You have a relevant education from university level and/or equivalent experience.
   

  

 We offer
   

  

 We offer you an interesting, fun, challenging, and developing environment together with engaged colleagues in the teams of Testing Enablement value stream and the section’s management team. In addition to career and development opportunities, we can also offer Scania employees other benefits, such as a company car, performance bonuses, a pension, flexible working hours, lunch at reduced prices, and much more. If you live in Stockholm, we offer a direct bus service between Stockholm and Södertälje, the Scania Job Express.
   

  

 Additional information
   

  

 Please get in touch with recruiting manager Mikael Pihlblad at mikael.pihlblad@scania.com, or Talent Acquisition Specialist Otto Wetterström at otto.wetterstrom@scania.com.
   

  

 Application
   

  

 If you are interested and feel that you have a fair share of what is mentioned above, please apply!
   

  

 Kindly apply with a CV and answers to screening questions as soon as possible, but no later than the 19th of February 2025, since selection and interviews will be held throughout the application period. Note that a background check might be conducted for this position.
   

  

 We look forward to reading your application!

title: Junior Analyst Program - Energy Commodity Analyst
description:
Om tjänsten
   

  

 Do you like to work in the dynamic environment of the trading floor? Do you want to contribute to high quality analysis and the success of the trading function using your analytical capabilities and commer­cial comprehension? In that case this job could be the right one for you.
   

  

 For our offices in
 **Hamburg or Stockholm** 
 we are looking for top talents to join our
 **Junior Analyst Program – Energy Commodity Analyst** 
 in the Trading Analysis & Algorithms department.
   

  

**The Junior Analyst Program – Energy Commodity Analyst:** 
 The program runs for
 **18 months** 
 and starts in
 **June 2025** 
 . It provides the junior analysts with exposure to the main energy commodity mar­kets Vattenfall is active in via a structured introduction to the different activities in the energy trading business and 3-4 analysis assignments (each 4-5 months). During the assignments you work closely with the respective senior analyst(s), trading algorithms developer(s), and trading desk(s) on a daily basis. The work on the trading floor will be complemented by workshops focusing on, e.g., your personal development or our Vattenfall principles.
   

  

 The Trading Analysis & Algorithms department within the Business Unit (BU) Trading works closely with the trading desks and takes the leading role in providing market insights, (fundamental and quan­titative) analysis, and ultimately commercial decision support across all commodity areas. As part of the department, the Algorithmic Trading desk works closely with the other trading desks and the Algo Infrastructure team and takes the leading role in algorithmic trading and automated trade execution across BU Trading from the intraday to term horizon.
   

  

**Your main tasks and responsibilities as a Junior Analyst:**
* Conduct commercially relevant fundamental and quantitative analysis to support traders and algorithms developers, and play an active role in developing trading and sourcing strategies
* Keep track of the latest market developments, identify key fundamental drivers and regime shifts, develop price views and sensitivity analyses, and provide related communication and advice to traders and portfolio managers through various communication channels
* Further develop the fundamental and statistical energy commodity markets modelling and interface with supporting functions on business-driven model development and policy analysis
* Play an active role in further developing and automating routines, procedures, and applications for analysis-related information and data
* Be part of the Trading Analysis & Algorithms department and contribute to its analysis output as well as the commercial success of BU Trading.


 Din bakgrund
   

  

**Our ideal Junior Analyst has the following qualifications and capabilities:**
* Strong academic background with a Bachelor’s degree or ideally higher in, e.g., business, economics, engineering, natural sciences or other relevant quantitative subject
* Knowledge and first experience (e.g., from internships or working student placements) in energy markets or algorithmic trading clearly advantageous
* Good statistical, analytical, and programming skills (ideally Python)
* Fluency in English (both written and spoken). Additional languages clearly advantageous
* Strong communication skills with the ability to communicate with various internal stakeholders and the willingness to share knowledge
* Result oriented, independent, and structured working method with high reliability and readiness to take on responsibility
* Proactive team player with eagerness to learn.


 Mer information
   

  

**Our offer**
 This is an excellent opportunity for ambitious and talented individuals who want to progress their career within a challenging and international work environment, and the possibility to work with some of the best people in the field. You will be working in interdisciplinary teams and you can always count on support from committed colleagues. We offer attractive employment conditions and opportunities for personal and professional development.
   

  

**More information**
 We welcome your application in English, no later than
 **February, 15th, 2025** 
 . We kindly request that you do not send applications by any means other than via our website as we cannot guarantee that we will be able to process applications that are not made via our website.
   

  

 For more information about the recruitment process you are welcome to contact our Recruiter
 **Carina Böhle** 
 via phone at +49 40 79022 1623.
   

  

 At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to build a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation.
   

  

 The recruitment process for this position will include remote written tests and a full day assessment centre incl. interviews.
   

  

 The security of Vattenfall and its employees is essential. For that reason, a pre-employment screening will be part of your recruitment process. The screening is based on the role you will fulfill within Vattenfall. The screening will be performed by a third party, called Validata. In addition, a certificate of good conduct (i.e. criminal record certificate) is required for certain positions.
   

  

 Are you a female student and want to know how you can contribute your knowledge to a leading energy company? Then register for our webinar: Female Students in Energy Trading.
   

  

 The trade union representatives in Sweden can be reached via Vattenfall´s switchboard +46 8 739 50 00. Sven-Gunnar Gremlin, Akademikerna and Anders Bohlin, Unionen.
   

  

 Since Vattenfall is a part of the Swedish critical infrastructure, many of our services are security classed. If this position is security classed the final candidates might be subjected to a security vetting process, according to the Swedish legislation.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**
 Om oss
   

  

**Vattenfall** 
 is a European energy company with approximately 20 000 employees. For more than 100 years we have electrified industries, supplied energy to people’s homes and modernized our way of living through innovation and cooperation. We now want to make fossil-free living possible within one generation. To be able to reach this ambitious goal we are looking for talented individuals who, in addition to their passion for their own role, also have strong team spirit and want to contribute to supporting a meaningful corporate mission.
   

  

**Business Area (BA) Markets’** 
 role in Vattenfall is to maximize the value of the overall portfolio by optimizing and dispatching, hedging, and sourcing for Vattenfall's sales and generation volumes. We serve as Vattenfall’s single access to energy commodity markets and trade electricity, emissions, fuels, freight, and renewable certificates. We employ around 500 professionals who are active across Europe with offices in Sweden, Germany, The Netherlands, and the United Kingdom.
   

  

 Within Markets the
 **Business Unit (BU) Trading** 
 is the energy trading hub of the Vattenfall Group. BU Trading is responsible for all trading activities around Vattenfall´s asset and customer flows to maximize value creation and improve sourcing costs. It provides market access services for the Vattenfall Group which means managing all hedging flows, from generation assets or customers, by Market Access. Next to handling our flow business, BU Trading also has a proprietary mandate.
   

  

 Our working environment is based on a collaborative approach, as we strongly believe that through teamwork, we can develop the most successful trading strategies. We have a culture of care and growth. You will collaborate with inspiring people around you, on complex and interesting topics. Together, we drive the energy transition and contribute to a journey towards becoming fossil-free.

title: Microsoft Teams Konsult – Fokus telefoni
description:
**Vill du ta din expertis inom Microsoft Teams till nästa nivå?** 




 Är du vass på
 **Teams Voice** 
 och
 **Teams Meetings** 
 och sugen på att arbeta hos ett företag som brinner för
 **Modern Work** 
 ? Vi har flera spännande uppdrag för globala kunder där din kompetens kommer göra skillnad. Är du redo att bli en del av vårt grymma team?
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 I rollen kommer du att vara en del av vårt Modern Work-team, där ditt fokus ligger på kundprojekt kring Teams telefoni. Hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta i spännande projekt, ofta hos globala kunder med huvudkontor eller annan koppling till Sverige. Kunduppdragen varierar i längd från kortare punktinsatser till längre leveranser tillsammans med kollegor från Exobe. I rollen kommer du att genomföra förstudier för kunder, rådgivning, designa lösningar kring Teams telefoni tillsammans med kollegor och ofta i nära samarbete med Microsoft. Vidare hjälper du kunder med konfiguration av Teams, teknisk vägledning i kontakt med operatörer, kontakt och rådgivning kring tredjepartsprodukter.
 



  





**Vi söker dig som har** 




 Vi söker dig som älskar att utvecklas, samarbeta och skapa lösningar som gör skillnad. Ditt driv, din nyfikenhet och din förmåga att möta kundens behov är avgörande för oss.
 



  





**Vi tror att du har:** 



* Erfarenhet av telefonilösningar och gedigen kunskap inom
 **Microsoft Teams** 
 .
* En vilja att lära och ständigt utvecklas.
* Mod att stå upp för dina idéer på ett ödmjukt och lyhört sätt.
* Ett genuint intresse för att dela med dig av din kunskap och hjälpa kollegor att växa.
* Flytande kunskaper i svenska och engelska.



  





**Meriterande:** 



* Tidigare erfarenhet som IT-konsult.
* Erfarenhet av
 **Microsoft 365** 
 och/eller
 **Skype for Business** 
 .
* Erfarenhet av kontaktcenter-lösningar eller projektledning.
* Certifieringar inom området.



  





**Egenskaper vi värdesätter** 



* Nyfiken: Du är ständigt intresserad av ny teknologi och metoder för att förbättra lösningar.
* Social: Du trivs i samarbetsmiljöer och har lätt för att knyta kontakter.
* Kommunikativ: Du kan förklara tekniska koncept på ett begripligt sätt för personer med olika tekniska bakgrunder.



  





**Varför Exobe?** 




 Exobe är en innovativ och inspirerande arbetsplats med fokus på utveckling, mångfald och skapandet av moderna digitala arbetsmiljöer. Vi ser till att våra anställda får möjlighet att växa och bidra i en dynamisk och stöttande miljö. Vi tror på att skapa ett
 **skönare arbetsliv** 
 – både för våra kunder och våra medarbetare.
 



 Exobe är ett konsultbolag i framkant med fokus på
 **Microsoft 365.** 
 Här får du arbeta med några av branschens skarpaste hjärnor i en dynamisk miljö där din utveckling och ambition står i centrum.
 



  





**Välkommen med din ansökan** 




 Om du tror att denna roll är rätt för dig, uppmuntrar vi dig att söka. På Exobe söker vi passionerade individer som är redo att bidra till vår resa framåt. Välkommen till Exobe – där innovation och människa möts!

title: Managed-Client Consultant
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and IT System Operations and Maintenance
description:
*Är du driven, teknikintresserad och har en passion för att skapa värde för kunder? Vi söker nu en Managed-Client Consultant som vill vara med och utveckla våra managerade tjänster. Hos oss blir du en del av ett kompetent team som arbetar nära kunderna och där ditt bidrag gör verklig skillnad.* 




  





**Managed-Client Consultant på Advania 🚀** 




 På vårt affärsområde Managed Services hjälper vi våra kunder att effektivisera och utveckla sin IT-drift. Vi ansvarar för teknisk leverans och support av managerade tjänster, centrala plattformar och klienthantering.
 



  





**I rollen som Managed-Client Consultant fokuserar du på att:** 



* Utföra tekniska beställningar, migreringar och implementeringar i kundmiljöer.
* Drift och Change-hantering av managerade tjänster, centrala plattformar, Intune och SCCM.
* Arbeta med applikationspaketering, samt hantering av image, drivrutiner och BIOS.
* Övervaka köer och upprätthålla SLA-nivåer och andra kundåtaganden.



  





 Utöver det ovanstående ansvarar du även för att stödja nya kunder och tjänster vid behov.
 



 Här hos oss kommer du att ingå i ett mindre team på 4-6 personer och bli en del av en större grupp med bred specialistkompetens inom exempelvis nätverk, Windows Server, Managed Client, Microsoft SQL och Microsoft 365. Du samarbetar nära andra konsulter inom Operations samt med våra sälj- och projektteam.
 



  





**Vad är unikt med denna roll? 🌟** 




 Rollen erbjuder dig en möjlighet att arbeta med komplexa IT-miljöer och en mix av tekniker som Microsoft Windows OS, Intune och SCCM. Du får utvecklas både brett och djupt inom ditt område och samarbeta i team med några av branschens skarpaste hjärnor. Som en del av vårt specialistteam får du också möjlighet att arbeta med större transformationsprojekt och bidra till att effektivisera kundernas IT-lösningar.
 



  





**Vad vi söker hos dig ✨** 




 För att trivas hos oss tror vi att du är en person som är nyfiken, analytisk och ansvarstagande. Du drivs av att hitta lösningar på komplexa problem och har en naturlig vilja att utvecklas. Du tar initiativ, arbetar strukturerat i grupp eller självständigt och har en förmåga att prioritera i pressade situationer. Din kommunikativa förmåga och servicekänsla gör att du enkelt samarbetar med både kollegor och kunder.
 



  





**Vi söker dig som har:** 



* 2-3 års erfarenhet av arbete inom IT Operations med fokus på Microsoft Windows OS och HW.
* Kunskap inom SCCM och Intune Autopilot
* Erfarenhet av applikationspaketering och hantering av image, drivrutiner och BIOS.
* Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet inom MSP-branschen.



  





**Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! 👋** 




 Visa gärna ditt intresse så snart som möjligt då vi intervjuar löpande. Vi välkomnar sökanden med olika bakgrunder, erfarenheter och synsätt, eftersom vi vet att en bredare mångfald berikar var och en av oss och stärker såväl effektivitet som kreativitet i vårt arbete.
 



 Alla slutkandidater kommer att genomgå en bakgrundskontroll som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess utöver personlighet- och logiktest. Välkommen att höra av dig om du har några frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten eller processen

title: Business Systems Consultant
description:
Hantverksdata is built for those who are building the country. We offer our customers market-leading cloud-based business systems for the construction and service industries. Strong technical solutions, combined with world-class customer service, allow us to continue offering the very best experience for our customers after 50 years. Today, Hantverksdata consists of over 100 driven and dedicated colleagues working in various roles but with a common goal. We utilize our broad knowledge to create a positive environment where we can learn from each other to reach new heights together! Hantverksdata is part of the HVD Group, represented in multiple countries with over 500 employees.
   

  

**Role Scope:**
 As an Entré consultant, you will work hands-on in the configuring the system, lead activities for clients, facilitate training in our ERP system, and ensure successful adoption of best practices. You'll collaborate with various departments, independently execute orders, and play a crucial role in project deliverables.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Engage with clients and independently execute system changes in Entré.
* Plan, execute, and meticulously follow up on orders or deliverables within projects, including diligent time reporting, documentation, and verification.
* Collaborate with project managers, department heads, and finance personnel to ensure seamless integration of Entré into various business processes.
* Ensure thorough testing, documentation, and facilitate a seamless handover to the support department for ongoing maintenance and client support.
* Build expertise in the Entré product, actively developing competence, and proactively sharing knowledge within the team.


**Skills:**
* Minimum 4 years of hands-on ERP system experience: We are specifically seeking candidates with a minimum of 4 years of practical experience in managing orders, projects, services, and administrative functions within accounting and payroll modules.
* Post-secondary education in technology, IT, or economics.
* Advantageous to have experience in the construction or craftsmen industry and understanding workflows in these areas.
* In-depth experience in practicing payroll or accounting is a plus.
* Excellent command of spoken and written Swedish and English.


**Qualities We Value**
* We are seeking an organized, proactive, and customer-centric individual committed to continuous learning and team


 If you share our excitement and vision but worry that your experience doesn't match all of the listed qualifications, please apply anyway! You could be the ideal candidate for this role or another in our ever-expanding organisation.
   

  

 We look forward to seeing you soon!

title: D365 Functional Specialist
description:
The D365 Functional Specialist serves as the subject matter expert for Microsoft Dynamics 365 applications, bridging the gap between business requirements and technical solutions. This role focuses on analyzing business needs, configuring D365 modules, and delivering functional solutions to optimize operations and achieve organizational goals.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
 Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand and document requirements, pain points, and objectives related to integrations needs.
   

  

 Review Functional design documents and provide the necessary feedback to implementation team and stakeholder.
   

  

 Understanding of Azure and D365 Environments from integration perspective
   

  

 Support Product Owner to approve FDD documentation
   

  

 Conduct workshops and process mapping sessions to identify gaps and opportunities for process improvement.
   

  

 Translate business requirements into functional specifications for D365 related to integrations
   

  

 Stay updated on D365 updates, new features, and industry trends to recommend enhancements.
   

  

 Proactively identify areas for system optimization and improvement in alignment with business goals.
   

  

 Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive innovation and streamline operations.
   

  

 Dealer Management System knowledge is added advantage
   

  

**Skills and Qualifications:**
 Experience: Proven expertise in configuring and supporting Microsoft Dynamics 365 modules
   

  

 Knowledge: Strong understanding of business processes in Finance
   

  

 Analytical Skills: Ability to analyze complex business requirements and translate them into effective D365 solutions.
   

  

 Communication: Strong interpersonal and communication skills to engage with stakeholders at all levels.

title: Customer Manager (EMEA)
description:
Our mission is to unlock value for every customer.
   

  

 We help people build their businesses around their clients, and unleash the capabilities of Planhat. We aim to redefine what customer success means in enterprise software.
   

  

**Team**
 Our role is to understand customers’ problems and objectives deeply, then help solve them through the Planhat platform.
   

  

**When Our Clients Are Successful, So Are We**
* churn goes down 6% at a legal software company because we helped unify data from separate systems, survey qualitative customer feedback, and analyse product usage patterns
* Faced with modest growth and heavy competition, we help an enterprise CRO and CFO conduct a white space analysis using data from Planhat, this kickstarts initiatives that help increase Net Revenue Retention by 7%
* five CS reps at a Fintech startup can handle 20% more clients; because we’re streamlining repetitive tasks like data entry and creating reports, as well as automating the onboarding of new customers


 In short, we elicit the aims and pain points of global CS leaders, help open people’s eyes to new possibilities, and then consistently drive high-value outcomes using Planhat.
   

  

**Most Of Our Customer Managers Today Have**
* Succeeded in a ‘closing’ role, either in sales, or CS (renewals, expansions, cross sales, upsales and churn prevention) at a B2B SaaS/fast-growth company
* Demonstrated success in managing a portfolio
* Been in a managerial role (but not everyone on the team has)


 ,
   

  

**Skills**
 In customer success, the value you bring to the table can’t be summed up by years of experience or a list of skills on a CV:
   

  

**Ambition:** 
 You’re ready to be a trusted advisor to global CS leaders, and help them overcome some of the biggest commercial challenges
   

  

**Driven:** 
 The magic doesn’t happen with fancy slide decks; it depends on your ‘whatever it takes’ attitude. Strategising with clients is the starting point, you’re not satisfied until you’ve handled all the nitty gritty details that ensure the business impact is real.
   

  

**Flexible:** 
 You like variety and constant challenges. In the same morning, you help an EduTech company standardise and automate their product training, next up you’re pitching a multiyear renewal to the CFO of an energy company.
   

  

**Tech-savvy:** 
 you enjoy working with software, mastering products, and driving their adoption, knowing the right level of detail to go into with different people.

title: Inköpschef (Purchasing Manager)
description:
**Inköpschef - Jobbbeskrivning** 




**Om Företaget** 




 Svenska Rotor Maskiner (SRM) är ett högteknologiskt företag som specialiserar sig på utveckling av kompressorer och pumpar för olika tillämpningar inom miljöteknik, såsom biogas, bränsleceller, värmepumpar och kylsystem. Vi erbjuder våra kunder unika lösningar för gaskompression, expansion och vätsketransport. Våra kunder och licenstagare finns över hela världen. Företaget grundades 1908 och har sedan dess fokuserat på utveckling av olika flödesmaskiner.
 



**Inköpschef** 




 SRM söker för närvarande en inköpschef. Det är en heltidstjänst på plats. Vårt kontor, inklusive R&D, prototyp och produktionsverkstad och ett laboratorium, är beläget i Kummelberget, Nacka, strax utanför Stockholm.
 



**Ansvarsområden** 




 Inköpschefen kommer att ansvara för att överse inköpsprocessen, förhandla med leverantörer, upprätthålla lagerstatus och säkerställa att material levereras i tid. Rollen innefattar också att analysera inköpstrender, identifiera kostnadsbesparande möjligheter och samarbeta med interna team för att nå organisatoriska mål samt bistå i planeringsuppgifter i vår egen verkstad.
 



 De komponenter som ska köpas in är vanligtvis gjutna och/eller bearbetade metalldelar, samt andra komponenter för roterande maskiner, såsom lager, tätningar och andra standardartiklar.
 



 Vi använder Monitor ERP-system, vilket kommer att vara ditt huvudsakliga verktyg för både inköp och produktionsplanering.
 



**Färdigheter och Kvalifikationer** 




 -         Helst mer än 5 års erfarenhet av inköp eller liknande arbetsuppgifter.
 



 -         Förtrogenhet med att använda ERP-system för inköp, helst Monitor.
 



 -         Helst kunskap och erfarenhet av bearbetningsprocesser.
 



 -         Bred teknisk kunskap.
 



 -         Inköps-, förhandlings- och lagerhanteringsfärdigheter.
 



 -         Hantering av leverantörer och supply chain-frågor i allmänhet.
 



 -         Dataanalys och kostnadsoptimering.
 



 -         Stort sinne för detaljer och god organisationsförmåga.
 



 -         Utmärkta kommunikations- och interpersonella färdigheter.
 



 -         Flytande i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
 



**Vem är Du** 




 -         Du har tidigare erfarenhet av inköp eller liknande roller och är van vid att använda ERP-system. Helst har du redan ett etablerat nätverk av leverantörer.
 



 -         Grundläggande kunskap om bearbetning, gjutning samt varor och tjänster är mycket meriterande.
 



 -         Du har stark affärsmässig förståelse och erfarenhet av förhandlingar och att hantera industriella motparter.
 



 -         Du delar vår vision om att bidra till en bättre miljö genom att utveckla teknologiska lösningar.
 



 -         Du tycker om att arbeta i en internationell miljö med kunder och leverantörer från hela världen.
 



 SRM är ett litet företag med ambitiösa mål och omfattande expertis. Med rätt attityd kommer du att bli en av våra nyckelspelare för framtiden.
 



  
 



  
 



  
 



  
 



**Purchasing** 
**Manager Job Description** 




**About the Company** 




  





 Svenska Rotor Maskiner (SRM) is a high-tech company specializing in the development of compressors and pumps for various applications within environmental technology, such as biogas, fuel cells, heat pumps, and refrigeration systems. We provide our customers with unique solutions for gas compression, expansion, and fluid transport. Our customers and licensees are located worldwide. The company was founded in 1908 and has since focused on the development of various flow machines.
 



  





**Purchasing** 
**Manager** 




  





 SRM is currently seeking a Purchasing Manager. It is a full-time on-site role.
 



 Our office, including R&D facilities, a prototype workshop, and a laboratory, is located in Kummelberget, Nacka, just outside Stockholm.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




 The Purchasing Manager will be responsible for overseeing the procurement process, negotiating with suppliers, maintaining inventory levels, and ensuring timely delivery of materials. The role also involves analysing purchasing trends, identifying cost-saving opportunities, and collaborating with internal teams to meet organizational goals, as well as assisting planning tasks carried out in our in-house workshop.
 



 The components to purchase are typically cast and/or machined metal parts, as well as other components for rotating machinery, such as bearings, seals, and other standard items.
 



 We use the
 **Monitor ERP system** 
 , which will serve as your main tool for both purchasing and production planning.
 



  





**Skills and Qualifications** 




 ·        Preferably, more than 5 years of experience in purchasing or similar tasks.
 



 ·        Familiarity with using ERP systems for purchasing, preferably Monitor.
 



 ·        Preferably, knowledge and experience in machining processes.
 



 ·        Broad technical knowledge.
 



 ·        Procurement, Negotiation, and Inventory Management skills
 



 ·        Supply Chain Management and Vendor Relationship Management skills
 



 ·        Data Analysis and Cost Optimization skills
 



 ·        Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
 



 ·        Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
 



 ·        Fluency in
 **Swedish and English** 
 , both spoken and written, is required.
 



**Who You Are** 



* You have prior experience in purchasing or similar roles and are familiar with using ERP systems. Preferably, you already have an established network of suppliers.
* A fundamental knowledge of machining, casting, and the goods and services highly advantageous.
* You possess strong business acumen and are experienced in negotiating and dealing with industrial counterparts.
* You share our vision of contributing to a better environment by developing technological solutions.
* You enjoy working in an international environment with customers and suppliers from around the world.



  





 SRM is a small company with ambitious goals and extensive expertise. With the right attitude, you will become one of our key players for the future.

title: Karolinska Institutet söker biträdande säkerhetschef
description:
**Vill du bidra till en bättre hälsa för alla?**
 Hos oss på Karolinska Institutet (KI) får du möjligheten att tillsammans med kunniga kollegor bidra till en verksamhet i internationell toppklass och arbeta i en omväxlande, innehållsrik och inspirerande miljö. Till KI:s centrala säkerhetsenhet söker vi nu en biträdande säkerhetschef som vill bidra till det viktiga uppdraget att driva, utveckla och samordna säkerhetsarbetet på hela KI.
   

  

 Säkerhetsenheten är en del av det gemensamma verksamhetsstödet (GVS) och arbetar med att ge kvalificerat stöd till KI:s institutioner och ledning. Enheten kommer att byta organisatorisk placering inom det gemensamma verksamhetsstödet för att möta växande behov och utmaningar inom säkerhetsområdet. Målet är en mer integrerad och effektiv säkerhetsfunktion.
   

  

 Säkerhetsenheten leds av säkerhetschefen och består utöver den biträdande säkerhetschefen av tre säkerhetssamordnare.
   

  

**Din roll**
 Ditt huvudsakliga uppdrag blir att tillsammans med dina kollegor driva, utveckla och samordna säkerhetsarbetet på KI. I uppdraget ingår att samordna, följa upp, analysera, rapportera och driva utvecklingen av intern styrning och kontroll inom området.
   

  

 Du kommer att genomföra och medverka i risk- och sårbarhetsanalyser samt säkerhetsskyddsanalyser. Dessutom kommer du att genomföra utbildningar och övningar med utgångspunkt i allmän säkerhet, hot och våld samt krisberedskap. Vidare kommer du att arbeta med analys och omvärldsbevakning inom området och leda arbetet med kontinuitetsplanering. Rollen innefattar även kravställning och projektledning vid säkerhetsinstallationer inom ny- och ombyggnadsprojekt.
   

  

 En viktig del i ditt uppdrag blir att skapa förutsättningar för en positiv arbetsmiljö som uppmuntrar till samarbete och kreativitet. Som biträdande säkerhetschef arbetar du nära och tillsammans med säkerhetschefen och du är säkerhetschefens ersättare vid behov. I tjänsten som biträdande säkerhetschef kan även uppdraget som biträdande säkerhetsskyddschef komma att ingå.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig med:
   

  

* Högskoleutbildning eller annan utbildning inom säkerhetsområdet i kombination med arbetslivserfarenhet, som arbetsgivaren bedömer likvärdig.
* Erfarenhet av arbete i en komplex organisation.
* Minst 3 års aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet av operativt och systematiskt säkerhetsarbete.
* God kunskap av säkerhetsskyddslagen, totalförsvar och civil beredskap.
* Goda kunskaper inom för säkerhetsområdet gällande lagstiftning.
* Goda kunskaper i normala IT verktyg samt svenska och engelska i såväl tal som skrift.
* Förmågan att arbeta strategiskt och strukturerat.


 Följande är meriterande:
   

  

* Aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet av utredningsarbete inom person och/eller ekonomisk brottslighet.
* Kunskap om Lagen om offentlig upphandling (LOU).
* Utbildning och/eller erfarenhet av Cybersäkerhet.
* Utbildning och/eller erfarenhet av projektledning


**Vad erbjuder vi?**
 En kreativ, internationell och inspirerande miljö fylld av kompetens och nyfikenhet. Karolinska Institutet är ett av världens ledande medicinska universitet. Vår vision är att driva utvecklingen av kunskap om livet och verka för en bättre hälsa för alla. Här bedriver vi framgångsrik medicinsk forskning och har det största utbudet av medicinska utbildningar i Sverige. Som universitet är Karolinska Institutet en statlig myndighet. Det gör att du får goda förmåner genom vårt kollektivavtal. Medarbetare på KI erbjuds också möjlighet till ett flexibelt arbetssätt. Det innebär att om den verksamhet du jobbar i tillåter, så kan du arbeta en del av din arbetstid på distans. Du får även träna fritt i våra moderna friskvårdsanläggningar där utbildad personal finns på plats.
   

  

**Placering:** 
 Solna
   

  

*Tio skäl att välja Karolinska Institutet*
**Ansökan**
 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan.
   

  

 Ansökan ska göras via rekryteringssystemet Varbi. I denna rekrytering söker du med ditt CV utan personligt brev. I ansökningsformuläret kommer du istället att få svara på några frågor om varför du söker jobbet.
   

  

 Vid tillsvidareanställning tillämpar Karolinska Institutet 6 månaders provanställning.
   

  

**Vill du göra skillnad – och bidra till en bättre hälsa för alla? Sök jobb hos oss**
 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Solna | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: STÖD 2-628/2025 | Kontakt: Magnus Håkansson, enhetschef magnus.hakansson@ki.se, | Facklig företrädare: Henry Wölling, SEKO henry.wolling@ki.se, Magnus Anå, OFR 08-52486437,magnus.ana@ki.se, Anna Sarkany, Saco anna.sarkany@ki.se, | Publicerat: 2025-02-05 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-02-26

title: Lead Solution Architect D365
description:
**LEAD SOLUTION ARCHITECT D365**
 Would you like to work in an international environment where you’ll make a difference every day? At Permobil, we’re looking for game-changers to join us as we innovate for individuals and develop the world’s most advanced assistive solutions.
   

  

 At
 **Permobil** 
 , the people who use our products come first. Our purpose is to create advanced assistive solutions that make the lives of adults and children living with disabilities more enriching. Our people are passionate about pushing the boundaries of technology to deliver innovations that improve lives. We are a sustainable and responsible business committed to continuous improvement, and our customers can trust us to provide market-leading solutions driven by insights-based clinical data.
   

  

**Position Overview**
 We are seeking a skilled and experienced
 **Solution Architect** 
 to lead and shape the functional vision of our Microsoft D365 initiatives. In this role, you will drive architectural strategy, providing leadership and direction for enterprise-wide projects on the Microsoft D365 platform. As the lead architect, you’ll align solutions with business goals and technology roadmaps, working with stakeholders and development teams to define functional specifications and bridge any gaps. You’ll support project teams, guide design decisions, and stay current with industry trends, shaping impactful, transformational D365 solutions for the business.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Lead functional architectural design for strategic, enterprise-wide initiatives on Microsoft D365.
* Provide guidance and governance to align solutions with business goals, technology strategies, and roadmaps.
* Perform architectural evaluations, solution analysis, and design to address complex requirements.
* Collaborate with solution architects, business owners, and stakeholders to capture business needs and document functional specifications.
* Define long-term strategic goals and actionable short-term plans for the D365 solution area.
* Research, evaluate, and select solutions (off-the-shelf, in-house, or third-party) based on business needs and document detailed specifications.
* Stay current with industry developments, adopting best practices to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.
* Identify and resolve gaps in existing solutions, ensuring cohesive, secure, and efficient designs.
* Guide project teams on solution design, impacts, and cost considerations, ensuring alignment with EA frameworks.
* Collaborate with the Enterprise Architect to align solutions with quality and security standards.
* Provide technical coaching to developers and ensure vendor compliance with business requirements.


**Qualifications & Skills**
* University degree in IT, engineering or related discipline
* Minimum 5 years’ experience from working as a Solution Architect
* Deep knowledge of the major business systems design and features within the area
* Profound understanding of system development methods and standards.
* Thorough insight of the business process related to the area
* Leadership experience is considered an asset


**Why is Permobil the next step for you?**
* You’ll make a difference. Every day. Everything we do leads to understanding and improving the lives of our users. Through our evidence-based innovation, we make a difference to people’s lives.
* You’ll make your mark as part of our future. We collaborate with colleagues across borders to Innovate for Individuals. The impact you make personally could lead change around the world.
* You’ll feel welcome from day one. We’re known for being great colleagues, who are collaborative, fun and at the cutting-edge. Everyone at Permobil cares as much as you do about making a positive difference.


**Application Process**
 We will conduct selection continuously so send us your application today or before
 **December 5th** 
 at the latest!
   

  

 Permobil is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals.
   

  

 For more information about the position, please contact Mats Weckberg, Director Enterprise Architecture, mats.weckberg@permobil.com
   

  

 For information about the recruitment process, please contact Zivile Mitkute, Talent Acquisition Partner, zivile.mitkute@permobil.com
   

  

**Please respect that we do not wish recruitment assistance or advertising, we decline calls from recruitment and advertising providers.**
**More About Permobil**
 Permobil founder Dr. Per Uddén believed that helping people achieve the greatest level of independence is a basic human right and, for over 50 years, Permobil has held fast to that belief. Permobil is a global leader in advanced rehabilitation technology, passionate about better understanding our users’ needs and improving their quality of life through state-of-the-art healthcare solutions. Today, those solutions include power wheelchairs, seating and positioning products, power assist, and manual wheelchairs.
   

  

 Permobil is part of Patricia Industries, a subsidiary of Investor AB, and is headquartered in Sweden. Permobil has 2 000 team members in 18 countries around the world. For more information regarding the company’s storied history and complete product line, visit permobil.com.

title: Engineering Manager - App team
description:
At Svea Solar, we’re reshaping the future of renewable energy, and our native app is at the core of our mission to empower customers to take charge of their energy journey. Available to all our customers, the app provides real-time insights into solar energy generation, energy consumption, and battery storage. It’s a vital tool for a greener, smarter future.
   

  

 To take this platform to the next level, we’re searching for an
 **Engineering Manager** 
 to lead and inspire our talented App Team. If you have a passion for leadership, technology, and sustainable innovation, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

 The role
   

  

 As the Engineering Manager for our App Team, you’ll be part of a group of 6 dedicated engineers. Working closely with our Product Manager you’ll ensure that the team delivers products our customers love while maintaining technical excellence and fostering a culture of collaboration and growth.
   

  

 This role strikes a balance between people leadership and technical expertise.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Help the team estimate work and planning of short and long term goals as well as updating PMs and stakeholders on changes
* Foster a positive and collaborative engineering culture that empowers the team to do their best work.
* Mentor and develop engineers, helping them advance their skills and careers.
* Ensure adherence to technical guidelines and continuously seek opportunities to improve processes and product quality.
* Work closely with the Product Manager to align technical efforts with business goals and ensure smooth communication across all of our software teams.
* Promote agile methodologies and help the team own their products from development to delivery.


 Are we a match?
   

  

* thrive at Svea Solar, it’s important that our values align with yours, as they are the guiding stars that help us move forward. Our organizational language is English, so fluency is essential for this position.


 We’re looking for someone with experience in leadership within an agile product organization. If you also have the following, you’re likely a perfect fit for this role:
   

  

* A technical understanding or background, ideally with hands-on experience in software development (Experience as a software developer is advantageous.)
* Excellent communication and leadership skills, with the ability to align teams and stakeholders around shared goals.
* A strategic mindset, able to balance technical priorities with business needs.


 At Svea Solar we believe in Collaboration-first mentality which is why we work three days at the office to share ideas and better collaborate between the teams.
   

  

 If this sounds like you, we’d love to connect! Apply now and join us on our journey to create a brighter, greener future.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

 At Svea Solar, we promote diversity and inclusion, as different perspectives drive innovation. Here, you will have the opportunity to grow professionally and contribute to the energy solutions of the future. As part of our team, you will play an important role in "The Power Shift" towards a greener future, focusing on teamwork, growth, and a fun working environment. 🌱🌞
   

  

**Svea Solar – More Than Just Solar Panels**
 Svea Solar is not only a leader in solar panel installations, but we also aim to be a long-term energy partner for our customers. We offer a broad product portfolio with smart solutions that enable our customers to optimize their energy usage. Our offerings include
 **heat pumps in collaboration with IKEA** 
 , electric vehicle chargers, batteries, electricity contracts, and our own
 **energy optimization software (VPP)** 
 . We are continuously working to develop new solutions that make a difference — both for our customers and for the climate.
   

  

 Application
   

  

* We will start reviewing applications immediately, so don’t wait to apply!


 - To ensure a fair assessment, our candidates will complete
 **tests in Alva Labs** 
 if they meet the essential requirements. Diversity is key!
   

  

* On this page, you will find more information about our recruitment processes.
* For the final candidate, we conduct a background check on criminal records.


 We warmly welcome your application! ☀

title: Sweden Regional Head of TA Delivery
description:
Grow with us
   

  

 Are you ready to lead, inspire, and transform? Ericsson is searching for a Regional Head of Talent Acquisition Delivery to play a pivotal role in redefining how we attract, engage, and onboard the best talent across the globe.
   

  

 At Ericsson, we’re building a next-generation Talent Acquisition organization that is as dynamic and forward thinking as the technology we pioneer. Our vision is to create a globally connected, highly consultative TA ecosystem that empowers you as a Regional Head of TA Delivery to act as strategic advisor to the business. This is your opportunity to spearhead a transformative journey, driving a future-ready talent acquisition model that aligns with our global strategy while addressing regional nuances.
   

  

**About This Opportunity**
 As the Regional Head of Talent Acquisition Delivery, you'll lead a team of talented Country TA Managers across a dynamic region, ensuring seamless end-to-end recruitment delivery. This isn’t just a job—it’s a chance to be at the forefront of an exciting transformation. Ericsson is reshaping how talent acquisition operates globally, and you'll be instrumental in crafting and implementing this vision. In this role, you will:
   

  

**Shape the Future:** 
 Work on high-impact initiatives that will set the foundation for the next generation of recruitment practices.
   

  

**Lead with Purpose:** 
 Champion innovative strategies to attract and retain top talent in one of the most dynamic and competitive industries.
   

  

**Collaborate Globally:** 
 Partner with leaders from across the globe to share ideas, solve challenges, and drive results.
   

  

**Enhance Your Expertise:** 
 Stay ahead of industry trends, explore cutting-edge technologies, and develop professionally in a role that encourages continuous learning.
   

  

 What you will do
   

  

**Driving Transformation:** 
 Build and execute regional recruitment strategies aligned with global objectives while innovating to meet regional needs.
   

  

**Leadership & Mentorship:** 
 Inspire and guide a high-performing team of TA managers, fostering a culture of excellence and collaboration.
   

  

**Performance Optimization:** 
 Own and elevate regional performance, managing resources dynamically to meet evolving business demands.
   

  

**Strategic Collaboration:** 
 Partner with global CoE teams in areas such as operations, sourcing, and employer branding to deliver an exceptional candidate and hiring manager experience.
   

  

**Change Management:** 
 Lead transformational initiatives, ensuring your region is ready to embrace new processes and technologies.
   

  

**Stakeholder Partnership:** 
 Build strong relationships with hiring managers and business leaders to anticipate talent needs and deliver tailored solutions.
   

  

**Champion DE&I:** 
 Lead efforts to embed diversity, equity, and inclusion into every stage of the recruitment process.
   

  

 What you will bring
   

  

**Experience:** 
 A proven track record of leading recruitment teams in a multi-country, complex, and dynamic environment. Experience managing high-performing teams and driving a performance culture.
   

  

**Skills:** 
 Expertise in stakeholder engagement and the ability to develop trusted partnerships with hiring managers and senior leaders. Excellent communication, decision-making, and critical thinking skills.
   

  

**Education:** 
 A bachelor’s degree is a plus but not required.
   

  

**Personal Attributes:** 
 A strategic mindset combined with strong operational execution skills, especially in areas like data analytics, change management, and compliance. A passion for embedding DE&I into all facets of talent acquisition.High adaptability with strong results orientation, creativity, and resilience.
   

  

 Our assessment process
   

  

 This recruitment process includes one initial phone screen, followed by two behavioral interviews and a case where we will assess the skills and behaviors we are seeking in our Regional Head of Talent Acquisition Delivery. The successful candidate will receive an offer to join our team after completed the full assessment process.
   

  

**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 759661
   

  

 ]]>

title: SAP Operations Manager -  Coop Sverige
description:
Do you want to be a part of shaping the future of SAP operations at Coop? We are now looking for an SAP Operations Manager to join our central SAP team!
   

  

 Coop is undergoing an exciting transformation, having recently implemented a new business system, SAP S4 and SAP CAR. Simultaneously, we have constructed Northern Europe’s largest fully automated logistics warehouse, located in Eskilstuna.
   

  

 This is an exciting role at Coop Sverige and we are looking for you who want to be involved and design the role according to the needs of the business. The role of SAP Operations Manager means that you will define processes and working methods needed for achieving efficient operations. You will take responsibility for delivering a great service in collaboration with our IT vendors and internal stakeholders.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Ensure that SAP platform services are delivered in accordance with agreed service level targets for performance, availability and security.
* Responsible for maintaining efficient governance.
* Gather input on business satisfaction levels.
* Identify areas and processes that can be optimized and continuously improved.
* Collaborate with business and IT stakeholders within Coop.
* Collaborate with partners and suppliers.


 The position is permanent with a 6-month probationary period starting by agreement. Working from home or at the office? We usually say "team over individual" and expect you to be at the office when needed, plain and simple.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**Who are you?**
* We expect you to be used to complex solutions and that you have extensive experience of having worked with SAP in a large/middle-sized companies.
* Experience working with various SAP producs such as SAP S/4 and SAP CAR is meritorious.
* You will have contact with many different stakeholders within the company and should therefore be a skilled communicator with good social skills.
* Working towards projects and management is just as important and engaging for you no matter what.
* Making difficult decisions and daring to push on is something you find fun and edifying.
* As we are in the beginning of our SAP journey it is an advantage if you have experience of establishing new teams.
* Fluent in Swedish and English


 The retail grocery sector is a stable and important part of our society. With over 4 million members across the country, Coop is a key player in pushing for a greener and more sustainable future.
   

  

 You will be part of a corporate culture characterized by humility, initiative, and strong values. We collectively take responsibility and have a strong desire to help each other succeed. Our office in Solna offers a modern and great working environment with a fantastic staff restaurant. At Coop, we work for our 4 million members, making us by far Sweden's largest cooperative.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the position, feel free to contact the recruiting manager Dick Due-Pedersen, email; dick.duepedersen@coop.se. Contact information can be found further down the page.
   

  

 To fairly match candidates with the demands of the role, we will use tests during the selection process.
   

  

 Please submit your application as soon as possible as we are continuously working on selection and interviews!

title: Affärsutvecklare / Rekryterare
description:
Vi söker en passionerad säljande rekryterare med en genuin känsla för att bygga och vårda relationer, både med potentiella kandidater och kunder. Ditt primära fokus kommer vara att driva och ansvara över rekryteringsprocessen, från att aktivt söka och engagera kandidater till att leda intervjuer och utvärdera potentiella talanger. I denna dynamiska roll kommer du även att ha möjlighet att expandera vårt kundnätverk och vårda befintliga relationer. Du är en drivande individ som är redo att växa inom företaget och gradvis ta en ledande roll. Vi har en distansbaserad arbetsmodell, men fysiska möten förekommer veckovis, därför söker vi en person som är bosatt i Stockholms län.
 



  





**Om dig** 



* Du är en driven och självgående relationsbyggare.
* Du trivs i att arbeta självständigt och mot högt uppsatta mål.
* Kommunicerar obehindrat på både svenska och engelska.
* Bosatt i Stockholm län



  





**Dina kvalifikationer** 



* Erfarenhet från rekryterings- eller bemanningsbranschen.
* Relevant utbildning och/eller erfarenhet.
* Meriterande är erfarenhet från tjänsteförsäljning, IT- eller konsultbranschen.



  





**Vilka är Valent?** 




 Valent är ett modernt och ungt IT-konsultbolag, med en unik modell, som framhäver frihet och samhörighet. Ta chansen att bli en del av vårt team och upplev ett spännande arbete i en inspirerande miljö tillsammans med fantastiska kollegor!
 



  





**Forma din framtid med oss** 



* En utmärkande och spännande roll
* Frihet under ansvar
* Sätta din egen prägel på arbetet
* Möjlighet att växa inom bolaget och kliva in i en ledarposition
* Urval och intervjuer sker löpande, tjänsten kan därför bli tillsatt före sista ansökningsdatum. Vi fram emot din ansökan via formuläret på vår hemsida.

title: Full Stack Developer & Startup Founder (March 2025)
job_function: Information Technology, Business Development, and Strategy/Planning
company_industry: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals
description:
**Note: This Opportunity Does Not Offer Employment, but rather an opportunity to build your own VC-backed startup!** 




  





**Who you are:** 




 You are a highly accomplished full-stack software developer with a demonstrated ability to deliver innovative solutions. Your exceptional programming skills and experience in building complex applications position you to tackle significant challenges within the tech industry. You possess a strong problem-solving aptitude and a passion for pioneering cutting-edge technologies. Driven to make a real impact, you're eager to leverage your expertise in building disruptive tech ventures.
 



  





**About Antler** 




 Antler is the world's most active venture capital firm, providing funding from pre-seed to Series C. We invest in Founders who seek to define our tomorrow and reshape the world we live in with groundbreaking technological innovation. Every year, we handpick the strongest Founders from more than 135,000 applicants across our 27 locations on the globe, which has led us to work with more than 7,000 founders to date and a portfolio of more than 1,000 startups.
 



  





**The Antler Founder Residency** 




 Join a dynamic cohort of 200+ highly motivated entrepreneurs for an immersive 12-week program. Visit our website for a detailed breakdown of how we'll support your startup launch.
 


* 12-Week full-time Immersive Journey: Kicking off March, 2025, in Stockholm.
* Co-Founder Discovery: In the first 10 weeks, collaborate with fellow Founders to find your co-founder(s).
* Pitch to Invest: Present your team and business idea to the Antler Investment Committee. Secure a net cash investment of EUR 100k for 10% equity.
* Accelerate Growth: If funded, we work closely with you to make your startup a success



  





**Program Details** 



* **Start Date:** 
 March 3rd, 2025
* **Location:** 
 Onsite at our Stockholm office
* **Compensation:** 
 While participants don't receive financial compensation during the program, pre-seed investment is available to jumpstart your venture.
* **Visa Sponsorship:** 
 Due to the non-employment nature of the program, visa sponsorship is unavailable.



  





**For our March 2025 cohort, we’re looking for someone who:** 



* Having the autonomy to develop sophisticated software solutions to address real-world challenges, merging ingenuity with functionality.
* Exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills, capable of breaking down complex issues and bringing structure into business cases
* Providing leadership, whether it’s directing a development team or managing comprehensive product delivery.
* You have an idea that you believe can solve a problem you are deeply interested in. You understand that you need co-pilots who share your vision and values.



  





**Application Process** 




 Our streamlined application process takes only 2-3 weeks:
 


1. Apply through our website.
2. Participate in an introductory interview.
3. Progress to an in-depth interview with our partners.
4. Receive a potential offer.



  





**Antler Success Stories** 




 Several companies built through the Antler program have received pre-seed investment and have gone on to secure significant funding rounds. Here are just a few examples:
 


* **Wingbits:** 
 A community-driven flight data tracking platform
* **Two:** 
 A comprehensive B2B payment suite simplifying sales for online and offline businesses.
* **Evyon:** 
 A developer of eco-friendly battery energy storage systems.
* **Glint Solar:** 
 Software accelerating the identification of optimal solar installation sites.
* **PerPlant:** 
 AI-powered sensor systems creating a gateway to sustainable agriculture.

title: Investment Banking internship programme 2025 H2
company_industry: Financial Services and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**Job Description**
*Are you an ambitious business or economics student with a strong interest in investment banking? Seize the opportunity to complete an internship in a rewarding environment at Danske Bank Investment Banking.*
 Each year we offer up to a total of 20 internship positions within Corporate Finance during five ten-week periods all year round. As such, you have the possibility to choose which period to attend in order to avoid collisions with e.g. course workload or exchange semesters abroad. We are now recruiting students to attend the internship periods starting in August and October 2025.
   

  

**What’s In It For You**
 You have the opportunity to take part in a challenging and fun internship where you have the possibility to develop and to take your career to the next level through hands-on investment banking experience. Apply by the 16 February 2025 at latest to have the chance to become a full time, full pay, valued member in our driven team in Stockholm.
   

  

 As a challenger on the Swedish market, Danske Bank is characterised by an entrepreneurial and innovative mind-set. We are looking for employees who strive for development, both of themselves and of our organisation. If you wish to develop both personally and professionally, we offer you a high level of responsibility, as well as an inspiring team and committed managers who encourage you to grow. We offer you an inclusive work environment where you will contribute to our success, today and in the future.
   

  

**Corporate Finance**
 At Corporate Finance, you will get valuable insights into the investment banking industry and experience the Corporate Finance profession in cross-border M&A and ECM activities. Your skills in financial analysis, valuation and strategic thinking will be put to the test. You will gain valuable experiences for your future career and increase your chances of a permanent position at Danske Bank Corporate Finance following the internship.
